Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beachcomer2
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel last spring, when prices were a bit cheaper (could get a room for just over $200US). Lovely room, best bathroom I've ever been in (navy blue speckled granite everywhere, modernist style, good sized, really lovely). Room was well-designed with a separate sitting area that can be screened off. Small cafe downstairs was just perfect with breakfast, coffee, wine, etc. Staff were helpful. The design can't be beat if you enjoy this style.

Reviews.Title: “ca pisani hotel, venice italy”
Reviews.Author: newyorkbailey
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful! The staff was warm, helpful, and wonderful! We were two women traveling together and when we checked in they asked if one queen was what we had requested. We told them no and they upgraded us to a loft apartment! We had a small living room and up some stairs we had two single beds in a loft bedroom. The accommodations were great! The hotel is a ten minute walk from St. Mark's Square and in a very quiet neighborhood. If you want more action or views, this is not the place to stay, but if you want a short walk to the action, this is a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “unique hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: m3grrl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in February 2012-- during a 30-year cold snap. Thankfully, the hotel upgraded us to a room with a jacuzzi tub, which we used often to defrost after wandering/getting lost in 20-degree Venice. As many others have noted, the hotel is in art deco style, and there are numerous thoughtful decorating details throughout. I'm not a huge fan of art deco, but there's no denying (and appreciating) this hotel's design. Location was great-- a bridge and short walk to San Marco square. We liked being a bit away from the ground zero of tourism in Venice. Breakfast was also great. Don't be shy about asking for a cappuccino (or two). My only complaint about the hotel was the mattress in the room. When booking, I'd ask for a room with a newer mattress. I'm giving this hotel four stars instead of five only because I'm opposed to grade inflation running rampant on TA, and I like to save a five rating for the truly exceptional. If I return to Venice, I would not hesitate to stay here again, and I would recommend it to friends. Beyond the hotel itself, our favorite restaurant was A Beccafico, where we ate twice. The owner (from Sicily, I believe) is very hands-on and engaged. Dinners started with a small pre-dinner cocktail and amuse bouche. For our second dinner, we needed to eat very early by Italian standards because of our flight departing at 6:00 am the next day. A Beccafico sat us very early (not sure the restaurant was even open), and the owner insisted on a comp'd dessert to end the meal (sorbet in a lemon-- fabulous). Vegetarians (like me) must be prepared to show a bit of flexibility in Venice-- it is a seafood town. The hotel desk will help you make reservations and has good recommendations. Being good tourists, we made our way to Harry's Bar. Overrated. 20 euro tiny martinis-- for a moment I thought I was in NYC (except the martinis would have been bigger). Shopping tips: Giuseppe Biasin, Salizada S. Polo (campo S. Polo) 2094 Venezia, had interesting hand-made etchings-- unique souvenirs that aren't masks! Il Prato, Calle delle Ostreghe, 2456/9 30124 Venezia, had great paper products. Serena Vianello had the best women's hats ever. Campo S. Aponal - San Polo 1226 - 30125 Venezia. (Sorry if I butchered these addresses.) FInally, it can be very expensive to get to the airport. We had to use a private water taxi followed by a van, given the hour our flight left and concern about freezing canals (I can't make that up). The 30-minute transfer, which commenced at 4:30 am, cost 150 euros. This is the only time I felt a bit ripped off in Venice. The hotel arranged this transfer-- I question if there really weren't less expensive options. Anyway, I believe there's a public water taxi to the airport-- just make sure your flight leaves at a reasonable hour so that the taxis are running. They were not at 4:30 am.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Never-Knowingly
Reviews.Content: Ca' Pisani tries to be a little different and it works. We had four nights here and found the room welcoming and comfortable. They have really tried to make the place special. Modern items like TV, mini bar and safe are built into antique furnishings; towelling robes and slippers are free; and the shower had a rather sinister looking handheld device for "accurate rinsing :-)". All guests were invited to a cocktail party on our first night by the manager. We only ate breakfast in the hotel and it was excellent - squeeze your own orange juice and a wide selection of meat, cheese, fruit, yoghurt and some hot food. The staff could not have been more helpful. I forgot the combination for my suitcase and after trying manfully to break in, the concierge was about to use bolt cutters. Then I remembered! The hotel is perfectly located within 3-4 minutes walk of both Accademia Bridge and Zattere. Both of these have vaporetto (water bus) stops. Once we found how to use them (very easy) we spent most of the holiday on these brilliant examples of public transport. Single trips are expensive (6.50 Euros) but 24- or 36-hour passes are good value.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, great service and nice room”
Reviews.Author: Bluelizabelle
Reviews.Content: Service is top-notch. The staff is professional, not over-intrusive and both restaurants recommended were local eateries that serve wholesome food. The room size was big, nicely partitioned for luggage storage. We had one of the rooms on the top floor, and it was nice to have natural sunlight coming in from the rooftop, in the bathroom and also the luggage storage room. There was a kettle and free flow tea bags/ coffee on each floor, which is a nice touch; considering how rare drinking hot water is available in all the hotels we stayed throughout Italy. Breakfast is one of the most memorable part of the stay. The crossiants were crispy, cheese, bacon, ham were all fresh. Dining room at the basement was bright and spacious. We had a great experience staying here, and away from the main crowd from San Marco. Nice neighbourhood, great location!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Kar62223
Reviews.Content: Although this review is over nine months late, I felt compelled to write. We arrived in Venice in the middle of the night due to a missed flight from Frankfurt. After finding our way to the Hotel Ca' Pasani, we were warmly welcomed. Our room exceeded our expectations. It was very large, by European standards. The huge bathroom, with whirlpool, was an unexpected bonus. They even provided liquid laundry detergent which I used in the bathtub in my make-shift washing machine. Of course there was a laundry line in the shower stall. The entire hotel was tastefully decorated. The morning breakfast, sitting outside on the avenue, was charming. It was a great place to sit and people watch. Besides the great location of the hotel, the best part was the staff. All spoke English and went out of their way to be helpful. I especially want to mention Miriam M. at the reception desk. She was kind and her English was great. I believe her mother was from England. We would not hesitate to return to this hotel and to recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great”
Reviews.Author: superheterodyne
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Ca'Pisani in August 2011. The hotel offers a truly great product, considering the organizational difficulty in Venice (delivery & collection of the smallest thing has to be done by boat and/or by means of men's strength...) The Art DÃ©co room was truly cosy and classy, and the vintage furniture - of very high quality - matches the Palazzo decorum very well. Yes it is not huge but it is perfectly fine for Venice and the bathroom was great with a bubble bath. Hotel staff delivers a great service while not being over zealous (which I personally appreciate). The terrace is delightful. The breakfast is simply the best I've ever had in Italy. Only the sheets could have been a litlle better - they were a bit worn. But this is a very minor point -- overall, this is a great place to stay in Venice and excellent value for money. (Location, ease of access, etc. has already been amply described by other travelers!)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Walter M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in October 2011. Location was terrific. We had a duplex room - small living room area on the first floor and the bedroom on the second. Bathroom was well appointed. Breakfast was very good and the employees in the dining room were very friendly. Front desk staff was unfriendly. Not rude, just unfriendly and robotic. Since they are the first people I saw, it impacted my perception of the hotel. My several interactions with them, including checkout are what make this hotel 4 stars instead of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection is not so far”
Reviews.Author: RAFAEL7Meudon
Reviews.Content: What we need more? Attractive place, nice people to receive you, in such a romantic city? Thanks to Ca'Pisani for this memorable week-end. If we had to note this place, we'll put 9,5/10. Why not 10/10? Just to help them to maintain their level. If we put 10, they'll have no more efforts to do to reach the perfection. Or we all know that nobody and nothing is perfect, but we try to reach it! Longue vie au Ca'Pisani. Gilles and Julia

Reviews.Title: “Ca' Pisani - wonderful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: WilliamJo
Reviews.Content: Less than one minute on foot from the Ponte dell'Accademia, in the Dorsoduro district, not far from the Peggy Guggenheim Foundation, this is a wonderful hotel in a great location. Each of the bedrooms is furnished with original Art Deco furniture, so each of them is different. It is an ancient Venetian palace but the choice of Art Deco furniture works well. The breakfast was excellent, the staff were both professional and friendly, and I would definitely stay here again, Not the cheapest place to stay in Venice but much better value than the Hotel Danieli and still in a perfect location. They don't have a pool or a fitness room but with all the walking you will be doing in Venice, who needs a pool or a fitness room? If you want to go for a swim, you can just take the vaporetto over to the Lido and go to the beach. This was a business trip but it would also be great for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: janejaneypp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at ca pisani for new year, just the two of us. Very convenient location in zattere just a 2 minute walk from the water transport stop. quiet little street very italian, im glad we didnt stay right on the grand canal as this was away from the hustle and bustle but within walking distance of everywhere, we set off each day in a different direction and explored the area. Take a map as a lot of the streets look the same and could easily get lost. The hotel was lovely, bedroom a bit small and bed very creaky !but bathroom was beautiful big and modern with jacuzzi bath, turkish bath on the third floor which was free and very welcoming after a long day out. We returned home of an evening to find our bed turned down and 2 chocolates on the pillow, a lovely touch. Tea making facilities on each landin which was fine but milk portions need to be provided,(they did ask for suggestions on this new idea ) Breakfast was buffet style good selection and staff very friendly, concierge were very helpful especially helping us to find somewhere to eat, go for the smaller trattorias as they are cheaper, rather than restaurants, and be aware that a cover charge plus tax is added before you even eat, in most places. We found that if you just want a slice of pizza or a quick drink it is cheaper to stand either at the bar or at the outside window where it is also served and very popular otherwise you pay almost double to sit down. A word of warning if you do go new years eve, a lot of restaurants shut quite early for private parties so you need to book in advance or just eat early. Head to st Marks sq with a bottle of bubbly, very very busy and a fantastic fireworks display. Cheapest way of getting from the airport is by Alilaguna which cost us 15 euros each, tickets can be bought from the airport arrivals, water taxi is faster but more expensive, hotel is just 2 mins away from Zattere stop. Had a wonderful short break would definately return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Design Hotel”
Reviews.Author: J H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this superb hotel in May 2011 and constantly return to many happy memories of a wonderful experience. The high-quality interiors, customer service and ambiance combined to excel our expectations. Ca'Pisani was an oasis of style - art deco with a glamourous twist, filled with unique furniture finds and custom designs. The roof top terrace above Venice was a stunning place to relax and consider our next adventures through the city. We found the Dorsoduro area perfect for us, excellent art and music being within easy reach. We recommend the hotel and it's team very highly and shall certainly stay again when opportunity allows. John & Jen, Cornwall UK

Reviews.Title: “Once more, and with the same pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Chalupin
Reviews.Content: We have stayed again this year (last week), at the Ca'Pisani in Venice: this is a really outstanding place for various reasons. The extraordinary kindness of all the staff, from the front desk, to the chambermaids, they are are all smiling, very efficients, available, and with a good sense of humour! The rooms are large, very comfortable, with a beautiful "deco-design" furniture, and a great bathroom (jacuzzi...) with fine bathproducts. The breakfast is delicious, with various types of dihes, and everyday something new, but always the sympatic smile of the breakfast maid. The situation in Venice is outstanding: just behind the museum of "Accademia", very near from two vaporetto's stops: one one the grand canal, the other one on Zattere; and two minutes walking from the Accademia bridge, which allows two reach very easily any part of the city, and the must is that one can benefit of all these facilities living in a very quiet part of Venice, without the flow of the crowd. Ca' Pisani is an unforgettable place, where we certainly will return, and return again: "the place" in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diane R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week this November during the Biennale. Perfect location in Dorsoduro for anyone who wants to take advantage of all the art and music that Venice has to offer. Beautiful room, comfortable bed and wonderful use of space. Discovered that the problem with too much heat in the room came from the heated towel racks in the bathroom. After turning these off, all was well. Yes - mosquitos in November, but the weather was unseasonably warm all over, so windows had to be opened. All staff were courteous and friendly and very efficient. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Lot of frills, but the basics?”
Reviews.Author: micgov
Reviews.Content: The premise is nice and very stylish, but my duplex room (nice, exp. the bathroom) was incredibly hot (early November) with no possibility of adjusting the temperature but opening the window. Dommage that the street by the window was a busy one and populated by mosquitos (in November, I could not beleive it). No AC active, no temp selector active, no taps to close the radiators in the room. When I asked for a solution, nobody from the lobby offered me a cooler room.

Reviews.Title: “Ca' Pisani - great boutique hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Turkus_Maximus
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a treat for my Wife and I, a delayed honeymoon. It was a suggestion by my good friend and travel expert Iva Dalco from Euroscape Travel (http://www.euroscape-travel.com). Iva really knows Venice!! The hotel was in a great location and very accessible to vaporetto routes (Academia or Zaltere) and many lovely rambling walks to the overwhelming choices of Venice's wonderful culture. The reception is organised, hassle free and quiet. There are options for guest lounges and quiet areas, a great restaurant which serves as the breakfast (generous) venue and the concierge is a mine of knowledge of all things Venetian. Best of all is the quietness of the location, the boutique charm of the decor (quite art deco'ish) which is unlike the run of the mill modern varieties and yet the personal small touches they add let you know you are important. The room was spacious, with a great layout, safe, lots of hanging space and the options of stairs or lift. The spa bath was very welcome, the shower a little strange (but hey this is Italy) but finally managed to operate it and bidet...plus heaps of mirrors which was wonderful for the bride.

Reviews.Title: “HOME AWAY FROM HOME”
Reviews.Author: JRSE
Reviews.Content: Caâ€™ Pisani is a lovely small hotel designed in the contemporary/art deco style. It serves a hearty breakfast and has a charming outdoor cafÃ©. The hotel is manned by a helpful and friendly staff headed by Marianna, the proprietress, who has weekly cocktail parties so that she can meet her guests and they can meet each other. After our 6 day stay it felt like a â€œhome away from home.â€�

Reviews.Title: “Perfect locaton”
Reviews.Author: tlarie
Reviews.Content: The room was beautiful and quiet,it had high ceiling and black out shades and was all around beautiful. The location is great for being out of the fray but close to anything you wan to get to. We wandered the Dorsoduro in the afternoon and evening and felt like we found some of the real Veince. The staff were helpful and attentive and the breakfast lovely. When we return to Venice we wouldn't consider staying anywhere but here.

Reviews.Title: “Restrained modern design in an old fashioned town”
Reviews.Author: trrricky
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because it was the only hotel from the Design Hotel group in Venice, our room category must of one of most elaborate bathroom setups in the city, and the location sounded good. We are happy we did. There's a beautiful rooftop terrace full of chaise longue and potted herbs and we'd go up there at sunset and listen to the church bells. We were always up there alone, which has an uninterrupted view of the city on three sides and we had perfect weather. Tres romantic. We stayed in one of the hotel's duplex rooms, which came with complimentary non-alcoholic mini bar drinks, woo! Our room was fairly expensive, but there were lots of little perks and amenities at the hotel and the location was absolutely perfect for us to see all the Biennale shows. Very near the Academia Museum, Guggenheim and Dogana. Ca Pisani is totally recommendable. The only big Venice feature it's lacking is that it's not right on the canal and canal view rooms are pretty magical. I was in a friend's room on the canal on this trip and though I liked our hotel much better, their view was utterly romantic, beautiful and unique to Venice. Still, you spend plenty of time on the water in Venice and our view from our room was quiet and charming of the neighborhood outside.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet alternative in a Venice hotel”
Reviews.Author: golfer031
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great choice in quiet Dorsoduro, and is ideally located just across the Accademia Bridge from the more heavily travelled areas of Venice. Yet, one can walk to St. Mark's Square or the Rialto Bridge quite easily. The hotel is beautifully designed, and is small yet spacious. Rooms are fairly large for Italy, and are quiet and well-appointed. Ca Pisani also has a wonderful wine bar/restaurant, which doubles as the breakfast room in the morning. The staff in the restaurant were especially gracious and hospitable. This hotel is a great choice for those travellers who are searching for a top quality hotel, yet prefer something more intimate and relaxed than the much larger (and more expensive) hotels that line Venice's Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: HJMH1
Reviews.Content: It can be a little nerve wracking choosing a hotel in Venice as the rooms can be small and the hotels a little weary. Ca' Pisani is certainly not weary and anyone looking to find excellent accommodation, convenient location and attentive staff should give Ca'Pisani a try. Our room was generously proportioned and there was plenty storage. TV and air conditioning worked perfectly. Exceptionally clean and comfortable. Staff were attentive and helpful and always acknowledged us as we passed. The owner Marianna, introduced herself and assured us of her attention should we require it. Such a refreshing change to meet the approachable owner and be assured that she was firmly at the helm. Great attention to detail thank you for a quiet and tasteful hotel. Oh, breakfasts were excellent by the way. Only improvement might be to supply tea/coffee facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Got it all!!”
Reviews.Author: dentistcathy
Reviews.Content: We have now stayed at this hotel for six years, and often more than once a year.May/Sept/Dec Location -quiet,accessible,beautiful. Decor-Calming ,cool,chic. Rooms-Spectacular.Great bathrooms,style features throughout. Could do with tea/coffee /kettle in room. Breakfast-lovely buffet,fresh fruit,breads,yoghurt,meats,and excellent coffee.Tables outside to watch the passers by-a real treat. Staff-Exceptional,from the reception Giovanni , Marco, Franco and others,to the porters,and the hard working breakfast staff Roberta and the restaurant manager.Nothing is too much trouble . Returning to this hotel feels like home from home in Venice-a gem!

Reviews.Title: “great neighborhood - average hotel, so-so service”
Reviews.Author: Mark H
Reviews.Content: we were looking forward to our stay at ca' pisani based on the review we read here. in advance, the hotel was very responsive and accommodating in making arrangements for an airport transfer for us (we are not seasoned international travelers). Wilma made the transfer very easy and enjoyable (although I had hoped someone would have a cart for our bags from the gate to the taxi). the hotel itself is in a very nice section of venice in the dorsaduro districs. we did a lot of wandering, and would not have wanted to stay in any other area. it was comparatively quiet, very convenient to the accademia and zatteri vaporetto stops, and within easy reach of all the major sites. i would say the service was average to below average for this price point. i have experienced excellent service at other hotels. while the staff here was polite when asked a question, they did not go out of their way to make sure we were enjoying our stay, or welcome us when we returned from a day's excursions. whenever i approached the front desk, whomever was there was facing the other way, on a computer or attending to something else. one of the gentlemen at the desk gave me wrong information about the travel time to florence -- i would have thought this was an easy question. My experience in general with service all over venice is that the entire city is tourist-fatigued, and cannot summon the energy to smile for one more visitor. the staff at ca' pisani seemed to suffer from this syndrome. the room was okay. very small, but neatly furnished. the beds were comfortable and the air conditioning worked well. the bath was clean and modern, but again very small. one thing that was very uncomfortable were the mosquitoes. I'm not sure if this is a problem all over venice with all the dampness, but our room was full of them, and we woke up with bites every morning. i would say that the entire place could use an update, as much of the decor appears dated and worn around the edges. overall, i was glad we stayed a ca' pisani because of the great location. i have nothing in venice to compare it to, but based on my other travels, this hotel only rates average in my book.

Reviews.Title: “a fine hotel with jacuzzi to soothe your feet”
Reviews.Author: gagou-traveler
Reviews.Content: I only expected the room to have a shower, as is often the case in Europe, but was pleasant surprised it has a very good bathroom with a bathtub and a nicely designed jacuzzi that is just right for my sore body and feet after walking several hours along the beautiful streets and canals of the city. The restaurant serves excellent full breakfasts, and their lunch and dinner menus are good too, if you prefer to be alone. The hotel is located in steps away from the Academia and 10 minutes walk to everything (the St. Marks Square, the Rialto, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Can't Think of Anything to Complain About”
Reviews.Author: MadeItToEurope
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in July 2011. The hotel was unique and very nice. It was also located in walking distance to pretty much anywhere we cared to go. The staff was responsive via email prior to the trip giving detailed directions on how to get there. We arrived late and were given some snacks as the restaurants were already closed. The room was awesome. Very spacious with lofted log ceilings. The design of the hotel was amazing (it IS a recognized Design Hotel). I loved all the nooks and crannies around the hotel where you could relax, look at art, read, etc. (too bad we never had time to do any of that!). There was even a rooftop area where you could enjoy the weather and call down for food and drinks (we never got to do that either). The on site restaurant was very nice. We had good food for lunch and breakfast was included with the stay. I enjoyed sitting outside to enjoy my wine. The concierge was exceptionally helpful. He organized a private city tour for my husband and I. She was fantastic - she was flexible, intelligent, funny, and knew just about everything in Venice. I loved Venice and I loved this hotel. It was not overly expensive. I would definitely stay here again with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: SwampGas
Reviews.Content: We had a package for 3 nights, included museum admission, dinner at La Caravella and a 'Junior Suite'. In actuality a full suite. Wonderful small hotel easy to get to but out of the madness of St. Mark's. Academdia and Guggenheim very close by as are Vaporetto stops and many nice restaurants and cafes. The included breakfast was great and a bonus was a free cocktail party one night. The staff was very helpful in meeting our needs, I couldn't recommend it higher.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at ca pisani”
Reviews.Author: sherdave5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights. We were extremely pleased with the choice. The hotel is located in a beautiful and special part of Venice, and very close to the Academia bridge. We found the design to be modern and tasteful. The staff was extremely friendly and gave us excellent recommendations. We stayed in a duplex room. The one point to mention is that the stairs are narrow and not easy to use if you wake up at night, so consider whether you really need a duplex before booking this room. We had a wonderful time and i highly recommend the hotel, we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Quieter Part of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Sanibelle1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ca' Pisani because it was within walking distance to the San Basilio terminal and we were leaving on a cruise the next day. We took the vaporetto to the Accadamie stop as directed but could not find the hotel at first, and I waited while my husband searched for it. This hotel is well situated for anyone trying to avoid the crowds in St. Mark's Square and it is close to the Peggy Guggenheim Museum. The walk to the pier takes about 10 minutes but triple that if you are dragging along luggage. It is a quick two stop trip by vaporetto and you can actually see your boat if you look along the canal. The hotel is small but very well appointed and very modern inside with all kinds of gadgets and gizmos to control things. Despite its size, the room was very comfortable and a quiet oasis in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Venice. There is a place to relax on the roof overlooking Venice while enjoying a drink or just reading and wifi is available throughout the premises. The hotel is well priced for Venice and also seems to offer discounts on many online sights. All in all, a good choice for a short visit to Venice. A really nice breakfast buffet is offered in the restaurant downstairs and service is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Love at first sight”
Reviews.Author: Its_Scandinavian
Reviews.Content: I write this review after our second stay at the beautiful Capisani in Venice. Since our last stay we have said we will return! Location is perfect in Dorsoduro, if you don't have to much luggage you can walk to from Piazzale Roma and take the cheap bus to/from the airport. Otherwise is the vapporetto to Accademia convenient. I love this spot because it is not so touristic as around the Marcus Square. You find shops and great restaurants such as Avogaria, Lineaombra and Il Gondolieri, just a few minutes waling from the hotel. First is looking like a humble place outside, but inside you get a very special experience. Beautiful and to the point well-decorated common areas and rooms. The rooms has a special funky style and it is very retro. I can't say that the art is typically for Venice, you could have the same style in whatever else city you visit around the Mediterranean. There are so many great features in the room, regarding lightning, air-condition, music and closet. Bathroom is one of the best bathroom I ever experience. Lovely and several amenities in a sparkling Italian tiles bathroom. Huge tub with jacuzzi function and separate shower with a brushy floor so you can't fall as well as good for your feet. I have stayed in both Deluxe room and Junior Suite and I can't really see any difference between these two room types, more than that the Junior Suite is a little bit more roomy. In the deluxe room you have complimentary soft minibar. Venice is an expensive city for hotel rooms but I think you however get a good value here. All floors have an art exhibition ongoing and make the stay a little bit more exciting. Staff at front desk are knowledgeable and service-minded. The hotel is perfect in all way! Ok, you can see it has been 10 years since the hotel opened and maybe they need to look into some updates - you can see that the floor is used and some marks in the bathroom but it is not at all bad or you can get the feeling of decadence. One thing that is very pointed to details is that they have well-maintenance green plants hanging outside all windows. Two things was a little bit annoying this stay. The bellboy was not special friendly, he couldn't find our room so we walked around with him in the corridor (how hard can this be - the hotel is so small). Finally I find my room by myself. (I didn't tip him and after that he was glowering at us at all time. I also find him sitting in the hotels corridor for a while and apparently speak private in a phone, he didn't moved his as so we could get through easier). So get a new bellboy! Breakfast is average and always included. However, I could prefer to have the opportunity to order eggs as I like it. They should work harder to fill up with the items. The breakfast on our check-out day was a catastrophe! Three persons working around, doing totally wrong things. We had to wait for coffee, no hot items this day (it was empty and not re-filled) and when another guest asked for more cherries he got the answer that he need to be patient. He didn't get the berries even if it was visible behind the bar desk. I have to let you know that the breakfast the other day (with other staff) was much better. I mentioned this upon check-out so I sincerely hope they will look into this. If I had that experience one more time here, I will not return which should be a shame because this is indeed a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Experience”
Reviews.Author: RandiLC
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel Ca' Pisani for our honeymoon in Venice. The staff was very helpful with all of our questions, since it was our first time in Venice. We stayed in the Junior suite and wow, what a beautiful and modern room. The hotel is the first art deco hotel in Venice and just beautiful. The hotel is also in a perfect location...being just minutes away from San Marco square. Also, there are some great little restaurants and shops are all around. They offer the best breakfast in the mornings. Perfect location, friendly helpful staff, and beautiful hotel.... Thank you so much for everything!!!

Reviews.Title: “Magic hotel, can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: AuntKer
Reviews.Content: We liked everything about this hotel - its smart design, fabulous quiet location, easy to find, great helpful staff, and an amazing room. I was worried about space when sharing with my two nieces, but we had a room on two levels, where they had upstairs and I had downstairs, sharing an amazing large bathroom. I had never had great dining experiences in Venice, but both restaurants recommended by the hotel were excellent. Wonderful to be a short walk from everything but in the calm quiet of Dorsodouro, with the Guggenheim and Santa Maria della Salute so nearby. Excellent breakfast and Wifi everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky perhaps, but we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: qqueen37
Reviews.Content: We stumbled into this unusual but well located hotel, when looking for an alternative to the pensione we had booked. The manager was charming and so helpful, we moved in straight away. To our delight, we found that all the staff were blessed with similar people skills . The rooms were very comfortable albeit designed for a business clientele. I'm sure the rooms were ultra modern about 10 years ago. In some ways this modernity just makes old Venice seem more alluring. We would definitely stay here again, especially as it is right next door to the Accademia.

Reviews.Title: “Great everything!”
Reviews.Author: Pgalvin2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property in early July. The location, the beautiful rooms and the friendliness of the staff, this place was great. From the rooftop terrace one could hear the accordion player on the street below, it was something out of the movies.The location was just far enough away from the madness of St. Marks, on the south side of the Accadamia Bridge. Definitely will stay there again in the future. Paul D. Gaithersburg, MD.

Reviews.Title: “A treasure of a hotel. And perfect location. We will return”
Reviews.Author: Ashleigh013
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 days at the Ca Pisani. What a delight! The Ca Pisani had recently been renovated into a design hotel from the Art Deco era. They spared no detail. Our suite was a two-level dream connected by a glass stairwell and the sleeping room upstairs had a glass floor. Our huge windows opened to the path and plaza where a lone violinist played in the mornings. Their breakfasts were unbelievable, complete with home made preserves and some of the best coffee we had--all served with amazing cheer. And a quick drink on the rooftop terrace refreshed us before dinner and more hours of walking this amazing city. This location is much preferable to the crowded, noisy St. Marks area. It's quieter, cleaner, more authentic, charming and central to everything. We were able to walk much of the city then treated ourselves to a couple of water taxi rides to get a different perspective on Venice. We cannot say enough about the fabulous staff at Ca Pisani, their recommendations were right on the mark, they were friendly, helpful and made our journey one of the best we've taken recently. Do not miss this hotel. Bob and Ashleigh Sawdon

Reviews.Title: “Second visit just as good as first”
Reviews.Author: joe3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here about 7 years ago and it was even better than we remembred.Excellent position in quiet street leading straight to Academia bridge on the Grand Canal.Lots of nice resteraunts nearby. Breakfast either in the hotel bar or in the open. Very helpful staff and beautifully appointed modern 'designer' room.Not cheap but worth evey penny.

Reviews.Title: “Good location excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Rafaelmosquera
Reviews.Content: The decorations are modern, we were received with courtesy our rooms were prepared on time. Rooms are very luxurious, big bathrooms with jacuzzi. Good bed and very clean, the only problem was a light over the TV that couldn't find were to turn it off and had to go to the front counter to know that if you push a small shelf below the TV it will turn off the light. Breakfast was excellent, strong cafe espresso, very friendly waiters preoccupied in giving the best service. This is my third visit to Venezia, and the first time in this hotel, will highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ca' Pisani”
Reviews.Author: SAMABTravels
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Ca' Pisani and loved it. Great location, rooms and staff. Could not have asked for a better hotel for our family vacation in Venice. Rooms were wonderful and staff very helpful. Great value for the price. Highly recommend and will stay there again on my next visit to Venice! Family of 4 from California

Reviews.Title: “One Calle off the tourist trail and a different world”
Reviews.Author: BurnReiver
Reviews.Content: Who would have thought that one could stay just behind the Accademia and be in a different world. You're literally in the heart of tourist Venice, but at the same time in the Venice of the Venetians. Sit outside for your breakfast and you will see the commuters from Giudecca walking from the Zattere ferry to the Accademia ferry stop with few tourists to be seen except those adventurous enough to travel to Giudecca. The rooms are eclectic and modernist, without being starkly modern, essentially they have a soul, and while there is sound from passing foot traffic this only adds to the Venetian experience. We found the staff friendly and helpful with excellent senses of humour, their demeanour was infectious and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We have stayed at a number of properties in Venice, and done our fair share of the full on tourist experience. This was easily our best stay, so close to all the tourist venues yet at the same time so much quieter and relaxing. You are equidistant from both the Zattere and Accademia ferries, so transport is not a problem, while this is an ideal location for investigating parts of Venice off the beaten tourist track.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and inexpensive (for Venice) hotel”
Reviews.Author: Berkshirebabes
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel with a lovely top floor room. Fabulous bathroom. Staff couldn't have been more helpful. Very good position. Only downside - the breakfast coffee. But don't let that deter you. A perfect place to explore Venice

Reviews.Title: “Loved it very much”
Reviews.Author: Jan_B_2800
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at this hotel. The Staff was very friendly and helpfull. You have plenty of space in a standard room, very well decorated. The room was cleaned twice a day !!! We got a free bottle of Prosecco for our birthday, which was a very nice -and unexpected- gesture. The hotel is situated within a two minutes walk distance of the Accademia bridge over The Canal (and WaterTaxi drop-off). We can certainly recommend this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good decor, good staff”
Reviews.Author: ARTskiEAT
Reviews.Content: We went to Venice for a week in June for the opening of the Biennale, and also before it got too hot. We had never been, so we didn't know much but found this hotel in the Wallpaper guide and cross-referenced with trip advisor. The location was really good because you are away from "the zoo" at San Marco, and in between the 2 vaporetto stops of Zattere and Academia , so it gives a lot of ease to move around. The room was really nice ( a suite) , if a bit dark. Our landing on the first floor to our room had great decor as well, with an art exhibit .Breakfast, which is included, is really good and the staff is excellent and cheerful. You can eat outside, and people watch. It's a quiet hotel, with polite guests and a very helpful staff. If it had a terrace to lounge on, it would be the best. There is a roof top, but it's for 2 , and when we were there the same couple staked out their territory everyday.The only suggestion I would make is to not use the hotel to book your water taxis to and from the airport, as it doesn't give you better service for the extra cost of about 40 Euros per ride. I 'd go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Venice, Italian hospitality combined with Italian design”
Reviews.Author: Photoarthunter
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a quieter area of Venice and therefore the best place to stay. Near all imporant locations, but not too touristic. Interior design is outstanding, the hospitality even better. The small restaurant provides you with honest and delicious meals, the rooms are of the kind "let's stay in the room" and the service is like "feel at home". What more could you wish for during visiting the Art Biennale of Venice? Can't imagine.

Reviews.Title: “We loved itm and would highly recommend it, great service”
Reviews.Author: Drwatson123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently planned a 4 day trip to Venice, we had never been before. Fortunately for us we chose the Ca Pisani hotel which turned out to be just perfect. Number one has to be the location, just off the Grand Canal near Accademia bridge, so not far to walk before you are amongst it! Secondly the hotel is fantastic, very modern, very clean and the staff could not have been more helpful. Thirdly the hotel is a short walk from the Zattere water bus stop where you can choose to travel to other parts of the area, also Zattere enjoys the afternoon / early evening sunshine, ideal for a cooling glass of 'Spritz' or cold beer!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: Joseca80
Reviews.Content: Expensive but good value due to staff and room amenities and most important-the location.Short walk to the Grand Canal and the Academia bridge.Water taxi from airport with porter assistance was appreciated. Very nice breakfast and access to good restaurants etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LondonLola
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights there for my husband's birthday in Feb. We had one of the top floor 'mansarda' rooms with lovely views over the roofs. The location is perfect, between Zattere & Academia boat stops and the Dorsoduro is a lovely arty neighborhood, away from the crowds of San Marco. The room was spacious and very comfortable. Large bathroom with jacuzzi. plenty of space for luggage & clothes. flat screen tv & free Wifi. Breakfast was good, plenty of choices. The only downpoint for us was that room service was not 24h but restricted to the restaurant opening hours. Maybe because it was low season. We arrived on valentine's day and the concierge recommended the Avogaria restaurant nearby and we were not disappointed. We had a fantastic dinner there.

Reviews.Title: “Unique art deco hotel”
Reviews.Author: barnythedon
Reviews.Content: Unique hotel: stylish art deco interiors and nice roof terrace. Rooms were spotless. Well located for the all the main sights but not in the manic St Marks area which is too full-on. Excellent restaurants nearby. Good choice at the breakfast buffet. The only minor issue was that the free wifi didn't work in the room but did in the reception area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location. Hope to return.”
Reviews.Author: trvldrms2
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at Ca'Pisani in May for 3 days to celebrate our 35th anniversary. We were very pleased with every aspect of our stay. Our room was very large-(I believe it was a junior suite) with the bathroom on the first level along with a sitting area and bedroom upstairs. Note for all that have trouble with stairs that though there are elevators to the rooms/suites ,there were stairs within some units so check before booking! The stairs were very unique-made of glass and artfully arranged. They were very interesting, a work or art really, but for me it was difficult, especially since the shower and bathroom were downstairs. Next time I will ask for a room without stairs-but most would enjoy the suite. That said-just for those with a handicap -(mine is invisable so they would not have known), I would definitly recommend this lovely hotel. I only wish we could have stayed longer. It was very convenient to everything we wanted to do, and yet set in a lovely quiet area that had a peaceful and safe ambience. The staff was very helpful with making arrangements for whatever we needed. We arranged through them a gondola ride-it was wonderful, and they made it very easy. (another note to my physically challenged friends though, be very careful while trying to exit the gondola!) There was a very nice breakfast buffet, and we also had a wonderful dinner at La Caravella. The resaurant was amazing-the food was perfection, and we really enjoyed the outstanding staff. I would highly recommend out this resaurant also. We had a lovely stay and would definetly like to return to Ca' Pisani. Venice was so beautiful that it overwhelmed me and made me cry at glance.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff... amazing bathrooms!”
Reviews.Author: tvd101
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel for our March 2011 trip, after exhaustive research on Venice hotels on the web... we were able to get a great web rate, and the reviews were very positive. And no wonder! This little boutique hotel is family-run yet professional. The front desk staff are welcoming and ready to help with restaurant tips, maps, directions, etc. When I booked online, I received an email offering to pick us up at the airport in a boat (they also offered flowers and champagne in the room upon arrival - for a price!) for EUR100. Though expensive, it was our first time in Venice and we'd heard about the difficulties navigating the city, so we took the option. It was worth it - no public transit hassles, no waiting, and as close to the front door as you can get on a boat. The location, although only a 20 minute walk to San Marcos square, is fantastic - the street isn't completely overrun with tourists, yet it's so close enough to wherever you want to go. And it was quiet (although most of Venice is pretty dead after 10pm). Perfect. The lobby is very cool. Everything in Venice is old, and this hotel has the old brick walls and beams of the ancient house it resides in, and yet has been fully updated with modern design. The elevator is pretty tiny, I'm surprised they could fit it into the narrow building in the first place. The room was clean, comfortable, boutique and unique. The bathroom was unreal, laid out in reddish-pink marble all around (16' ceilings!), massive soaker tub, and heated towel rack. Breakfast every morning was included, and is standard continental fare - cheeses, yoghurt, meats, great espresso, juices, bread, etc. Highly recommended. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “They do everything they can to make your visit spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: ssofaer
Reviews.Content: An elegant room with a soaking tub and separate shower; location next door to the Accademia and a few blocks from two different vaparetto routes; you avoid the crowds of San Marco by being in a more truly Venetian envrironment; great breakfast either in your room or, even better, at their buffet. Best of all, a staff, in the hotel and the restaurant, that are warm, extremely helpful and knowledgeable, and always there for you. These folks are the best.

Reviews.Title: “Supern hotel”
Reviews.Author: 7ericcantona
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all, great service, superb buffet breakfast (croissants are excellent), fantastic design and it couldnâ€™t be much better in terms of location. Itâ€™s next to Galleria dellâ€™ Accademia and only a 10 minute walk to Piazza San Marco. The rooms are beautifully decorated and the hotel is very chic. A real effort has been made in this regard which is very refreshing. When I next visit Venice, I will most definitely stay at Ca Pisani again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Venice location and experience”
Reviews.Author: JennyB_10
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Venice and stayed at the Ca'Pisani Hotel in the Dorsodura area. We were really delighted with the room - the decor is contemporary and the bathroom was roomy. Service was excellent and the breakfast was great in the morning and the bar a good place to sit in the evening and also very reasonable in price. The hotel is close to the Peggy Guggenheim gallery which was a highlight but it is also easy walking distance to San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: dunesdweller
Reviews.Content: The attic rooms where I stayed are extremely charming with loads of character and well laid out and pretty outlook. The locations is great - not directly on the water perhaps but it hardly matters as the water is a very short walk either left or right so you can get the everything you want very easily. Service was very good and the whole facility is very well managed.

Reviews.Title: “CAN'T WAIT UNTIL OUR NEXT VISIT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alton22
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Ca Pisani and we are already looking forward to our next visit! Ideally located in a quiet area 2 minutes walk from Accademia Bridge and 10 minutes from San Marco. Friendly and professional staff are very helpful and make you feel very welcome. The rooms are comfortable, clean and in line with the rest of the hotel are stylishly decorated. Breakfast was excellent!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: tourist_or_traveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location, close to the main sights but far enough away not to feel overwhelmed by the crowds. Our room was at the back on the second floor and it was very quiet. The room itself was fairly large and it also had a large bathroom. The windows have electric blinds which are very useful but we only found the switch by accident. There was a good selection of items at breakfast and you can also squeeze your own orange juice. The air conditioning was a little noisy but all the windows open so keeping the place cool wasn't a problem. Some of the staff at the front desk could have been more friendly and it would have been nice to have a key that we didn't have to hand in every time we went out. The wi-fi only worked in our room at the door but it was ok out in the hall and on the roof terrace. Also, the shower cubicle was a little small. Don't let these minor issues put you off. This is a nice hotel and I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, really well-appointed room, great breakfast and warm, helpful, professional staff”
Reviews.Author: capisani
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel from which to explore Venice. Getting around from here could not be easier. Booking experience was great and staff very responsive and helpful when we needed to modify booking. Room was perfect - even for a long 5-night stay like ours. Plenty of stoarge space for clothes, suitcases and other personal items. Bed very comfortable, with quality linens, pillows etc. Even great coathangers - and plenty of them! Great bathroom. And we even had a view!! Breakfast - range and quality of food very good. All staff delivered service with warmth and professionalism. If we are lucky enough to make another trip to Venice, this hotel would definitely be our first choice. We loved our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: whatever4631
Reviews.Content: This is a charming boutique hotel with a quaint and quirky interior design. Front desk help is excellent and the hotel has easy access to water lines to both the Grand Canal and the airport, so you won't need to schlep your luggage over steps that cross canals to get where you want to go. Only improvement suggestion for hotel would be to purchase some new matresses for the beds.

Reviews.Title: “HIdden GEM with a Modern Flair”
Reviews.Author: chinnudc
Reviews.Content: The Caâ€™Pisani Hotel is an absolute gem conveniently located about a two minute walk from the Accademia Vaporetto stop. The hotel is part of the Design Hotel chain and is beautiful and modern inside. Each floor/room is beautifully appointed and unique in their design. The rooms are extremely comfortable, spacious and modern, yet have a charm that is truly distinctive and elegant. Free WiFi is included in your room rate which is an added bonus. The staff is friendly /accommodating and they aim to please. I highly recommend this one of a kind gem!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MEvangeli
Reviews.Content: Had discovered the Ca'Pisani through the wine and cheese bar several years ago and finally returned to Venice and stayed there. The hotel was lovely, our room was quite exceptional with a bathroom and a shower room and beautifully furnished and spotless [room number one]. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. It is in a very good location, next to the Accademia and it wasn't far to walk wherever we wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you need in Venice”
Reviews.Author: pmsj
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers everything you need in order to enjoy a great stay in Venice. We had a junior suite adjoining a superior double room, as we were travelling with our two (almost) teenage children. The rooms , particularly the suite, were large, well appointed, modern, comfortable and clean. The lovely wide corridors of the hotel and the lovely roof terrace were fantastic. We had breakfast at the hotel which was exactly what you need and offered the full range, served by such friendly staff..faultless. The help from the main desk was exceptional. They offered to arrange whatever we wanted, but were not at all pushy. They arranged water taxis to and from the airport and fresh flowers for the room. Their recommendation for dinner on every occasion (three) were spot on and the restaurants were fantastic, and just the type we asked for with respect to quality of food, cost and ambience. The hotel is in a lovely location, far enough away from the main throng of tourists around St Marks, but close enough to walk there in 10 mins or take a vaperetto from the stop which is 2 mins from the hotel. The immediate surrounding area of the hotel is superb. I spent alot of time researching hotels in Venice, as I didnt want to stay in a cramped rickety hotel or one which you paid excessively for just because of its name. The hotel rooms do not overlook any canals so if you want that this is not available, but for us this was not the priortiy as we were out most of the day on the canals. I cant recommend this hotel highly enough, it is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding in Venice”
Reviews.Author: DDD2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, and many of our friends stayed at the Ca' Pisani for my daughter's wedding in March 2011. The hotel was wonderful in every way. All the rooms were comfortable, and spotless, and the staff cold not have been more helpful. The hotel has lovely communal areas where we could all meet, and drink!, and a lovely roof garden. Air France managed to lose our case on the may out, but the hotel staff were really helpful in recovering it. I would recommend thsi hotel very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Ca' Pisani Hotel is the best hotel in Italy!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jlo-tish
Reviews.Content: We began our honeymoon in Venice at the Ca' Pisani Hotel. Our room was very comfortable and nicely decorated. The bathroom was wonderful with a nice, deep jacuzzi tub and even a bidet! The staff were all very personable and helpful. They greeted us each time we went by the front desk. Brought us an umbrella, when we went outside and discovered that it was raining (without being asked). Their breakfast buffet was terrific!!!! Their variety of food truly would satisfy anyone. We don't usually eat big breakfasts, but could not help ourselves, since it was soooo good!!! We were so spoiled after the Ca' Pisani Hotel, the other hotels that we stayed at, could not compare!! We also enjoyed their steam bath. It was very clean and private, with a nice outdoor deck to cool off on afterwards! All in all, it was the highlight of our trip from a hotel stand point!!! Great job Ca' Pisani!!!! If you want to go to Murano, don't take a complimentary boat ride, take a vaporetto on your own. The complimentary trip is a high-pressure sales thing, and you don't get to walk around the island at your leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, earning its four stars, perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: ubi07042
Reviews.Content: My wife and I evaluate hotel options prior to travel through careful study of dozens of print sources and then numerous on-line sources such as TripAdvisor. We found the Ca' Pisani consistent with its self-image and its long-standing fine reputation. We chose the Ca' Pisani for our first trip to Venice in large part for two reasons. (1) Location with easy access both to St. Marks and to the museums and other sites along the Grand Canal. (2) The sliding doors in the junior suite which we confirmed in advance would enable us to fully divide the spacious room into two rooms, in case needed to accommodate different sleeping patterns. The location of the hotel turned out to be even better than we imagined, with its convenience to two vaporetto stops on different sides of the island; the vaporetto service, we found, was remarkably reliable and efficient (we quickly learned the value of the seven-day vaporetto passes, the value of having a hotel not adjacent to the water traffic noise, and the advantages of being away from the souvenir stands and crowded pedestrian traffic that confront even the fronts of several luxury hotels near St. Marks). The Ca' Pisani has spacious stairways and halls, tastefully furnished and decorated, with a stylish, welcoming atmosphere. The design matches the website photos, and you can judge in advance the degree to which the art deco style coheres with your personal aesthetic preferences. (I would therefore suggest disregarding that strange critique which challenges Ca' Pisani interior design; also, there was during our stay no front desk clutter and no sign of backpackers.) The Ca' Pisani does not have a cavernous plush lobby, which to some guests may be a shortcoming. Wi-fi is available at no extra charge. My wife and I had one dinner in the hotel restaurant and found it excellent in both food quality and service; we therefore found it curious to see the restaurant typically uncrowded, sometimes empty. On another night, we sat down to order dinner there and, when we suddenly realized we were running late for a concert, we asked the waiter to just put some rolls in a bag for us, so that we could eat at least something while walking. In a few minutes, he gave us, to our surprise, a bag of small hastily made sandwiches, which he was embarrassed to serve (and refused to charge us for), but which were excellent and for us, in our musical emergency, a godsend. As it turned out, the quality of the staff as a whole is a strength of the hotel equal to its location: welcoming, attentive, helpful, knowledgeable, friendly, as good or better than we have experienced at similarly rated European hotels--indeed, with the personality, humor, and irony that often are unfortunately absent in the front desk staff of luxury hotels (and without the stiffness or obsequiousness that ARE sometimes found in fine hotels). We received excellent help and advice on numerous details such as shopping (e.g, where to look for fine Italian chocolate) and transportation (e.g., train services and tickets to Padua; but be sure to buy your Scrovegni Chapel tickets well in advance). Our home is near New York City, and we are used to fine restaurants (as well as high restaurant prices). We were therefore delighted to find that the restaurant La Bitta, modest in appearance but with its superb food (and also modest prices) was a short, pleasant walk from the Ca' Pisani. On a less positive note: (1) We found the free-standing shower in our room rather shallow and felt sorry for the maids (who also provided excellent service), who would daily have to clean up the escaped water, along with the soggy towels we used to dry the floor around the shower. We were told later that we had been assigned to the one room in the hotel that was configured, as required by law, for wheelchair shower access. (2) Initially we occasionally found our room a few degrees warmer than we prefer. It turns out that the temperature is controlled at the front desk and we learned to verify each evening, as we returned past the front desk, the temperature setting we prefer (in mid-March, in our case, simply turning the heat entirely off for the night). (3) We requested a quiet room away from the wide, front pedestrian street. Our room was one flight up across a narrow walkway at the rear of the Accademia, but we did find that, when our windows more open, the occasional conversations of passersby were noticeable in the room even from that walkway. Perhaps in a busier season, Ca' Pisani guests may want to be even fussier than we were in the location of a quiet room. We were impressed and pleased with the Ca' Pisani and don't want to exaggerate these concerns, which are included here as a possible aid to readers and future guests.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Design Hotel in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: gi013
Reviews.Content: CÃ  Pisani is an elegant and cosy hotel located in one of the best part of Venice. The atmosphere is warm, modern with a great attention to details. The rooms are characterized by a beautiful interior design, as all as the rest of the Hotel (lobby, restaurant, main floor). It's without any doubts an higlt quality hotel !! Great service, professional staff and excellent restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy & Cosy Design hotel in nice area in Venice”
Reviews.Author: jtoday
Reviews.Content: The Ca Pisani hotel is absolutely gorgeous. The room was very stylish and spacious. The bathroom was very sleek. The staff was very friendly and very helpful and even gave us an upgrade. The Ca Pisani hotel is in a great location. It is very close to must-see places like St Marco place, Dogen Palace, La Venice Opera, but just far enough away to not be overwhelmed by tourists staying in hotels. A great stay for a great price! For a romantic weekend or a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Let's be ABSOLUTELY honest...”
Reviews.Author: GlobalHedge
Reviews.Content: I know this hotel receives top reviews but let's be honest...this is a hotel for people absolutely on a budget. It is certainly not a high-end boutique hotel. If you are on a tight budget looking to save money then this place is fine but for you high-end travelers this place will disappoint. The location is absolutely perfect but the hotel is absolutely average. I'm still not quite sure why its called a "design hotel". I hate to offend the hotel but the design is quite poor and dated as the furniture is old and feels very used. It's in desperate need of renovation. I'm sure the italian gods of design would agree :-) . The rooms are tiny even for Venetian standards. You can hear every move your neighbor makes in the room next door: when he walks, when he showers, when he snores, when he turns on the TV, when he.... The premises look dirty but are actually clean so that's not an issue. The breakfast buffet is "ok" but absolutely what you would expect from this type of hotel. I wanted to fall in love with this place before i arrived as all the reviews were absolutely great. From the second i saw the cluttered front desk i knew it wasn't what i was looking for. If you are looking for an impressive design hotel then this is not the place for you. If you are backpacking thru Europe or simply on a tight budget and aren't too fussy about hotels then the Ca' Pisani should suffice simply becuz of the wonderful location. By the way, I would like to say the staff were very polite and friendly which was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: gastronomygoddess
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely hotel duing Carnivale and enjoyed our stay immensely. The location was incredible, right next to the Accademia and the heart of Venice. The staff were wonderful - helpful, courteous and professional. They had an amazing breakfast buffet that had generous hours to accomodate all guests. The rooms had nice touches, such as blackout blinds and hidden storage areas. The hotel itself is a work of art. Everywhere you turn, it is finished to high standard and aesthetically pleasing.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we wanted in Venice”
Reviews.Author: CAL2011
Reviews.Content: My two daughters (ages 10 and 11) and I stayed at Ca' Pisani for about 5 nights in June 2010. The staff were remarkably helpful by email as I was booking our trip (they even researched hotels in Ravenna for us!), greeted us by name upon our arrival, and recommended wonderful restaurants and destinations throughout our stay. In terms of aesthetics, the hotel successfully combines the "old bones" of the historic private home with very attractive contemporary art and design. Our rooms and bathroom were beautifully appointed -- though the "sunrise clock" was a little silly. The only downside was noise from the hall, though it didn't keep us awake.... Lastly, the location in Dorsodouro, just 1 minute from the Accademia, was perfect for our wanderings.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful decaying city filled with friendly spivs who only want your money.”
Reviews.Author: Newryite
Reviews.Content: Still here - night 3. The fair sized room is quite expensive at well over Â£100. The double bed takes most of the available space. There are lots of gadgets; electronics open & close window shutters, room temperatures and the do not disturb sign. Spa bath & shower very pleasant. Bathroom well equipped - lots of soap, cotton bud & balls separate toilet & bidet. Breakfast is fine but only 1 type of ham and 1 type of processed cheese - there should be mote choice st these prices. There is a machine if you want to squeeze your own orange juice - most of the oranges are tasty blood oranges! The coffee is no better than just ok. Now getting here - you can expect to be asked for â‚¬100 from the main airport to Venice - then you'll have to get to the hotel by water taxi. This is not, repeat not a luggage friendly place. The water taxi fare is only good value if you buy a 1 day 3 day or a week pass as a single journey is â‚¬6:50 for 1 person. Once on board you are going to Academia and the Hotel is 3 minutes once you disbark. Venice is expensive with pizzas easily averaging â‚¬12 plus a scandalous â‚¬2 to sit in, plus a service charge and with diet coke and latte about â‚¬3:50 and beer can be over â‚¬5 for 330ml it quickly and subtly becomes an expensive puzza. The pubs and sometimes thr cafes are good value but you must be ever careful for the spiv - yes they are charming and usually helpful but they only want your money. Use of a public toilet costs â‚¬1:50, so if you want a good deal best avoid Italy. A gondala ride 80 euro for 35 minutes - 80 euro if its one or 6 people - my return flight from Ireland cost less. Liked Venice but won't rush back to it or Italy as I begrudge paying to pee and just to sit in a restaurant. And in truth â‚¬12 for an ungenerous pizza that becomes â‚¬20 just with the addition of a glass of coke, cover and service well that's taking the p**s - worse still add a latte and you'll approach â‚¬25 for one person - at home I can get a three course meal for two people and a bottle of wine in a good restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Chic at the Right Price”
Reviews.Author: Ge0rgeandGracie
Reviews.Content: We stayed off-season at this modern, but retro-furnished hotel, with comfortably-sized rooms, especially for Venice, pleasing views, and all the high-tech amenities. Service was responsive and friendly but not intrusive. The concierge (Giovanni) even managed to express mail to us some cheese which we had bought as small gifts, but had left behind in the fridge. Although the entry lobby is small, there is on each floor, a interestingly furnished living area, which runs the length of the floor. The hotel is located in the Dorsorduro, which is in an area of museums across the Grand Canal from St. Marco's, and perhaps one or two stops away by vaporetto and is quieter and less commercial. There is a computer for guests' use at no charge, and the rooms are also set up for your own computer. An informal, cute cafe where a good, complimentary breakfast buffet is served also serves light meals which is very convenient on days when the winter weather is inclement. At 170 Euros including breakfast, this was a great buy, and Venice is beautiful off-season. However, we plan to return in May, even at the higher prices, as comfort is assured.

Reviews.Title: “unique, cannot be ignored”
Reviews.Author: Chalupin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed in Ca' Pisani for eight days last week... It was not our first visit: I know that hotel for ten years and have been there a lot of times, but every visit it is a real and deep pleasure: the hotel is a jewel of elegance, has an oustanding location in Venice (near a bridge, near everything but far from the noise), everyone in the hotel is incredibly nice, competent, efficient, the bedrooms are very comfortable and pleasan, well furnished, lighted and decorated.......and the breakfast is great! It is THE place in Venice where one has to stay....

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to base yourself in Venice”
Reviews.Author: CynWorldTraveller
Reviews.Content: For my first ever trip to this amazing city, I really feel lucky to have chosen Ca' Pisani as my base for the 6 days I spent exploring Venice. Firstly, the location is exquisite - unless you're looking for that 'view of the Grand Canal' experience (which I wasn't). My needs tended more to ease of access to all that Venice has to offer, resisting hotels which increase your reliance on Vaporetto/water transport. Sitting quite literally behind the Galleria dell' Accademia (and the Accademia Bridge), Ca' Pisani provides a variety of transportation options. The Hotel itself is funky in its decor, very art deco in style. My room, a junior suite, was spacious and clean and well tended throughout my stay. The staff are courteous and responsive - not overly solicitious. The La Rivista restaurant, which provides the venue for breakfast, is small though adequate for the task, and serves a breakfast buffet style from early to late morning - great if you're an early riser wanting to get out and explore! Having experienced 3 days of Acqua Alta (if you're travelling between November and March - bring your wellies!) during my stay, the hotel provided a warm and dry welcome for what was a brilliant experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and ambience.”
Reviews.Author: leslieksm
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth trip to Venice and our first stay at Ca Pisani. We will always stay at Ca Pisani in the future. It's location was a short walk to most of the cultural and sightseeing spots but in a quiet neighborhood. We found our room to be larger and with more amenities than other comparably priced hotels in Italy. The modern decor was a nice changes well. Also highly recommend sister restaurant La Caravella -- worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico”
Reviews.Author: rah1234
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wonderful weekend staying at the Ca' Pisani in Venice. Located just over the Acadamia Bridge on the south side of the Grand canal it's just far enough away from the tourist hourds but a short walk from most sttractions. We had a junior suite which was beautifully appointed, You could see that the owners had spent some money here as the finish was quality. I had a couple of small quibbles. One being there was no small table by the side of the arm chair in the small seating area so I had to put my drink on the floor. The other thing was the bed was a little too soft and the headboard squeeked every time I turned over. The bed, I presume an art deco original was a little too short for me or maybe it was that I prefer a bed with no board at the foot end, I found I couldn't stretch out. The bed linen was the best I'd ever seen in a hotel, beautiful. The breakfast was very good with everything I could expect and presented well. The staff were polite and helpful especially at the reception. I deliberately left some important sights out of my tour so that I have to come back again when I will be staying at the Ca' Pisani. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: muffin563
Reviews.Content: I did plenty of research before booking our hotel for our 5 days in Venice and was not disappointment with our choice of the Ca'Pisani. It's a smaller hotel in a cute neighborhood away from the busy tourist area of San Marco square and the Rialto bridge, but within walking distance of everything. Plus it's a quick walk straight off the water taxi - which is important when you're carrying luggage. The rooms are decorated funky with an art deco style. It's also very quiet. There were plenty of other guests staying that week but we barely ever heard anyone. We also enjoyed the steam room up on the top floor and the rooftop patio every afternoon. There are no cars in Venice so all you heard were birds chirping. Before out trip I friended the hotel on Facebook and the manager, Marianna, immediately sent me a message asking for our dates. She was very helpful with any questions I had before we arrived so if you're going to stay there, I suggest you do the same. I would love to return to Venice again and would definitely stay at the Ca'Pisani again. And if you plan on taking a gondola ride, I recommend doing it at night. During the day the canals are end to end with tons of gondolas. When we did it at night, we were the only one on mostly every canal under a moonlit sky.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, welcoming, stylish, in fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: DesignTraveler
Reviews.Content: Numerous stays at Ca Pisani only serve to reinforce my highest recommendation for the hotel - a warm, welcoming, and stylish homebase for your Venice explorations. The front desk staff is impeccable and helpful with good insider knowledge and the rooms are wonderfully comfortable and well designed. Plus your room rate includes free wifi and breakfast - so all immediate needs are taken care of. The location by the Accademia, with easy access to the central part of Venice, but removed from the tourist hustle-bustle. The new Punta de la Dogana museum, plus Peggy Guggenheim are steps away, and the Zattere facing Guidecca provides ample space for strolling as well as numerous cafes and restaurants. In short, stay at Ca Pisani!

Reviews.Title: “Bored with guests”
Reviews.Author: JackoSharon
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff ranged from outright disdain to pained assistance. When I arrived, the man at the desk never stood and greeted me but rather tried to pawn a lesser room off when he knew that I was entitled to an upgrade. ( which I finally got after I insisted). The acqua alta was in full force, so I bought some rubber boots. I asked the desk if they knew of a charity to which I could donate the boots. A head shook no. I found, two doors down , a religious youth house which gladly accepted them. I informed the desk of this and was met with a shrug. To be fair, the staff at breakfast were very cordial. Otherwise, find somewhere else to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Great Location, Wonderful Staff, Beautiful Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: travelcityguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the most comfortable hotels I have ever stayed in (since I travel over 60% of the time). The location is very fairly near Saint Mark's Square and with in rather easy reach of the all of the city of Venice and its monuments and charm. The breakfast was wonderful including Fabio who served it. He was a hit with our group. The rooms are beautiful, comfortable, and stylish. However, the people noise on the street (which is really not the hotels responsibility) was excessive, at certain times. The cocktail hour with the owner of the hotel was wonderful as well, and occurred on Thursday night. I have never had anything like that. Mariana was wonderful, interesting, and fabulous. She alone would the reason enough to stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Venice Splendor”
Reviews.Author: johnny811
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent six nights at the Ca' Pisani in October, 2010. Our stay, in a word, was fantastic. We stayed in a junior suite which had plenty of space and my wife loved the bathroom. The art deco furnishings were a really nice change from the usual surroundings. The location, very close to the Academia Bridge, was wonderful and made for lovely explorations of the Dorsoduro. Breakfast was more than we expected, with plentiful choices and a sophisticated atmosphere. The best feature of this hotel was the wonderful and attentive staff. They were very knowledgable and helpful at all times. They made our stay a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Large, clean and well designed rooms - Modern Art Deco in enchanting Venice”
Reviews.Author: MissLizaNYC
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through Tablet and was not disappointed. Venice was our first stop, after 15 hours of flying and a 15 day Italy road trip ahead. I planned the trip for 4 gals from the US - a dream trip - and Ca Pisano was the answer to our jetlag'd prayers. Rooms were quite spacious and so tastefully decorated with vintage Art Deco pieces with a modern twist. Beds were large and linens were luxurious and comfortable. The Bathrooms were spotless and modern complete with hairdryer. The location (across the bridge from all of the "action" in Venice, in Dorsoduro, ended up being blissfully perfect. Away from the maddening touristy crowds in a real neighborhood - very close to the amazing Peggy Guggenheim House/museum and easy to get anywhere walking. We heard the sound of accordion music, clicking of heels on the brick walkways, guitar strumming and church bells ringing. The front desk staff was more than accommodating with ur every need including setting up tours. The bar downstairs was a great place to start the evening- but not a place to have dinner. Breakfast buffet was also plentiful with delicious selection of breads, yogurt, cereals, fruit, fresh OJ, and hot eggs and meat with unending coffee. The only drawback (if you could say there is one) is that they do not have their own water "dock" because they are not directly on the water (which makes no difference btw). Call or email the hotel and ask for the closest docking point so you do not have to wheel your luggage over bridges to get to it. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pritch
