Reviews.Content: We stayed in mid October, we have not been to Venice before so I have nothing to compare to but we found it to be very well located. The decor is good the rooms are spacious and we had a standard room. My husband loved the blanket on the bed and has made me try and find one similar! Breakfast was varied and lots of it. We had a drink after dinner one night in the bar and where the only people in there and felt that the barman wanted to go home, its was only 9.30pm, however things do not seem to go into the night here, understandably as there is so much to do and see in the day. I must admit I didn't find the staff overly helpful, they where polite but no more. Overall a lovely stay in a beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Aloonak
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel in a great spot. You can walk to anywhere easily. Nice bed and bathroom. Very helpful staff. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: williamvictor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ca' Pisani from Sept 8-10. We thoroughly enjoyed Venice and our stay in this hotel was really unforgettable. Francesco and everyone at the front desk were always helpful and accomodating. The servers at the breakfast room was also great, and of course the food was really good too. We will definitely recommend this hotel to our friends. Kudos to the Ca' Pisani staff and management

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: pmckeating
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to Venice and I'd been a little disappointed by arrogant service and substandard rooms. No longer! Ca' Pisani was superb. Our room was gorgeous - lots of lovely wooden features, unobtrusive and useful bits of modernity and a terrific view over the rooftops of Dorsoduro. The location of the hotel was great and they very kindly arranged a (private!) boat trip to the island of Murano for us. The staff were knowledgeable, helpful and polite. There were some lovely touches to make us feel welcome - like the way they prepared the room for bedtime when we were out in the evenings. We were made to feel quite special staying here. Venice might be quite an expensive city to visit, but this place was terrific value and we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: dpatters
Reviews.Content: This is our second time at Ca Pisani. The staff is superb. Our double superior room was super clean and spacious. We plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service! Excellent location! Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AMP45
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel is outstanding! It started with the prompt replies during the reservation process, continued great service from the front desk staff, the restaurant staff and the management team through out our entire stay. We stayed in the junior suite, the room is very spacious. It is a boutique hotel and has all of the comforts one would expect. The bed linens and lighting in the room were both fantastic. A separate jacuzzi tub in the bathroom is a nice amenity after walking all around Venice. The location is perfect! The hotel is located directly behind the Accademia. It was so pleasant to stay away from the crowds of San Marco. There are many good restaurants within just a few minutes walking of the hotel. The cocktails at the Hotel's wine bar, La Rivista are very reasonably priced and the staff are so very nice. The tables outside are charming and a great place for people watching. We had a wonderful stay at Ca Pisani and would definitely stay there again. Tip: If you plan on taking the Vaporetti to the airport from the Zattere stop down the street, please note there is direct service, however that service does not start till about 9am. If you have an early morning flight, you will need take the Vaporetti from Accademia to San Marco and transer to the line for the airport. Restaurant Tip: La Bitta restaurant about 5 minutes walk from the hotel through lovely quiet streets. The restaurant does not serve fish but has outstanding food and service, we went there twice. Make sure to have the fresh mozzarella and the vegetable crepes...outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “New World Comfort, Old World Service”
Reviews.Author: FearlessCritic
Reviews.Content: I say the Ca' Pisani is a small gem for three reasons: Giovanni di Stefani (the manager), the cleanliness of the entire hotel and the superb rooms. Mr. di Stefani gives a warm welcome, wonderful restaurant recommendations, precise directions and does it all without being overly familiar or "in your face": it was clear to us that our happiness was important to him; the place is impeccably clean: even the breakfast bar which, given their large variety of choices could easily become sloppy, was always appetizingly neat as were the rooms, the common areas and the elevators and lastly the rooms are a miracle of compressed luxury: beautiful appointments, jacuzzi tub, very comfortable beds and a phenomenal shower. I've stayed in much more expensive hotels in Italy but none better. We loved Ca' Pisani and can't wait to go there again. If you are arriving in Venice by plane and taking the boat go to either stop Zattere or Academia; the hotel is equidistant between the two.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, contemporary design, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: dublintraveller100
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our fourth visit to the Caâ€™ Pisani, this time for three nights. A key advantage of this hotel is its excellent location on a (relatively) quiet street in eastern Dorsoduro, beside the Accademia and about 200 m from both the Canale Grande and Zattere, thus with excellent vaparetto links. The hotel is a late 20c conversion of a town house but differs from many similar Venetian ventures as the interior has been completely remodelled in contemporary â€˜designerâ€™ style and on the whole successfully. Some rooms are duplex suites with the bathroom and bedroom at different levels. Rooms and bathrooms are well furnished and are air-conditioned. Lighting is better that usual for Italy. Breakfast is an adequate but rather â€˜averageâ€™ buffet in the hotelâ€™s La Rivista restaurant, which also serves high quality and good value light meals throughout the day. All the staff we met were friendly and helpful and the hotel seems carefully managed. There is free WiFi and a free public computer. Recommended, especially to seasoned Venetian visitors not on a tight budget. Tip â€“ try the nearby Agli Alboretti restaurant for excellent risotto options, accompanied by high quality wines by the glass.

Reviews.Title: “great little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: schildkrout
Reviews.Content: good room, quiet, wonderful area of venice, elegant but understated

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service in design hotel”
Reviews.Author: bellab65
Reviews.Content: It seems that in so called design hotels, you often give up friendly service for a trendy room. That's not the case here. The staff were wonderful and made all sorts of special arrangements for us that I know took them a tremendous amount of time. They couldn't have been more gracious and helpful. And you do get a trendy room! Rooms are beautifully designed, although somewhat small, and the public areas are lovely. It is one of those hotels where it takes me a day to learn how to work the lights, but that's probably just me. The location is great, in a quiet section near the Accademia Bridge away from most of the tourist traffic. There's a small restaurant with a very nice breakfast (included) that serves only light meals. You can sit at a table outside and enjoy great people watching. I'd definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: weimanj
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three wonderful nights here after escaping from another Venice hotel. The rooms, the staff, the architecture, the location, the food were wonderful, not to mention the extremely efficient air conditioning which we desperately needed after 100 degree days in Venice. Can't recommend Ca' Pisani highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “A special hotel in a great area near Accademia”
Reviews.Author: suzielee_77
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable, relaxing and stylish hotel close to Guggenheim Museum and Accademia.The bedrooms are large with a spacious bathroom and inner hallway for dressing, beds are huge with beautifully laundered bedding, pillows and sheets. Lighting is especially cozy and the electric window blinds and stylish window dressing is simple and elegant. We only enjoyed breakfast at the hotel as we chose to eat in different locations while in Venice, but it was plentiful and fresh. We checked out by 12 noon on day of departure, then used the roof terrace in the late afternoon, for a lazy hour reading, the kind reception staff offer my daughter and I the use of the second floor bathroom for us to shower and freshen up prior to departure to the airport, this was a real treat, with fresh towells and toiletries. I would certainly recommend this small hotel and we will return next year to see the Bienniale.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and modern room, Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: jeffharry
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a room at this hotel for our two night stay in Venice during our honeymoon. It is located 5 minutes walking distance (if that) from the Accademia water bus stop, very convenient. The neighborhood this hotel is located in is really really nice and cute and unique. Plenty of good food is located five to ten minutes away down the narrow walkways of Venice. The staff were very helpful (specifically, they printed us a map of the exact location of one of our dinner locations - this is very helpful in Venice where roads and passages are not clearly labeled or understood by visitors) and friendly and nice. If you want to be away from all the tourists and enjoy a few nights sleeping in a quiet yet fun and energetic neighborhood, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: juliusrocco
Reviews.Content: This little gem, part of the Design Hotels group, has many very positive attributes and well worth your time in Venice. Perfect location: directly behind the Accademia, just a few steps from the Grand Canal, with vaporetto stops (Accademia and Zattere) on either end of the street, and a very efficient, pleasant desk staff/concierge service. Rooms are tip-top shape, all mod cons, and very quiet for a good night's sleep. The Dorsoduro is a nice area for a weekend getaway, and the Ca' Pisani is a short, few minutes stroll to the Peggy Guggenheim collection, and there are many restaurants, cafes, and wine bars within arms reach (a trip around the corner to Cantinone GiÃ  Schiavi for apertivi is an absolute must--you can believe the guidebooks on this one). A generous breakfast is provided with the room rate at the downstairs cafe/restaurant, La Rivista, and hotel staff go out of their way to help you have a great stay, no matter how early you need a water taxi to the airport. A very well-appointed hotel that fits very nicely within the Design Hotels group aesthetic. They also offer last-minute reduced room rates that are very reasonable. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Relieved to find a proper hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Commerce90
Reviews.Content: We spent hours and hours trying to find a good hotel in Venice that was not a tourist rip-off, damp, old and grossly over-priced. Reading through the Trip Advisor reviews, this proved very difficult. The Ca'Pisani was clean, modern, good size room, great value and a 2 min walk to the canal. Would highly recommend. A standout vs the tired and worn overall poor quality hotels in Venice. Only downside was lack of a restaurant / room service but a good continental breakfast is served in their coffee shop / bar and there are plenty of restaurants within a short walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Superb but more for a romantic break!”
Reviews.Author: GeraldineD2
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a friend for a long weekend - superb boutique hotel, amazing bathroom, wonderful room service, delicious 'tapas-style' food, very friendly and helful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: hipbyron
Reviews.Content: Ca Pisani made our stay in Venice very enjoyable. The staff could not have been more helpful, the location was quiet and not far from all the places of interest,museums etc. In all of our travels through Europe Ca Pisani was the best hotel. Ian & Helen , NSW Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in venice”
Reviews.Author: vern_50
Reviews.Content: We were here for 3 nights at the end of March for our 25th Anniversary. The hotel was in a good location to walk everywhere. The proximity to the Vaporetto stop was also good. We had one of the rooms that had the Bedroom on top. It was very clean and comfortable for the stay. We missed our connection and did not arrive until 11 pm. The only thing that was tough is that all of the resturants were closed. We adapted with Apples and peanuts and a bottle of wine. The Resturant had a great selection for breakfast and were very friendly. The reception staff were helpful and made us reservations each night. All in all a wonderful stay! I would highly recommend this hotel due to the location and the staff that work there.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: jillwindyridge
Reviews.Content: A great location to get to from Accademia or Zattere, very easy to find. All the staff were very pleasant and helpful, our room was made up twice a day, the chocolate supply was great especially the Easter fish on our pillows. The design of the room kept the noise to a minimum, we were surprised to realise that there were 3 young children in the room next to us & we hadn't heard them at all. Interesting art books and a seating area on the 2nd floor were almost missed. Breakfast kept us going until the evening and changed slightly each day. There are some lovely bars & cafes around although we did find that places closed around 9pm. We enjoyed the food in the Taverna San Trovaso by the bridge (up from the gondola repair yard), and also the cheap Prosecco and cicheti at Al Bottegon Wine bar on the same side. The student area around Campo di Margherita was also a good place to people watch and enjoy cheap food & drink.

Reviews.Title: “A welcome return to Venice after 7 years”
Reviews.Author: Nelulu
Reviews.Content: What a perfect choice for our anniversary visit to Venice. Our best hotel in Venice yet for our fifth trip. Really welcoming, nothing too much trouble, superb room & excellent (and large) bathroom. All beautifully presented and just where we wanted to be! Will definitely return on our next trip and hope that the only slightly off note of rather unfriendly breakfast service will have been corrected. Beware the use of the automatic coffee machine - ask for proper espresso!

Reviews.Title: “Best Breakfast, Fabulous Room!”
Reviews.Author: madchickenlittle
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple, breakfast inclusive. The hotel expected us, had the room ready even though it was early for check-in (Thank you! Those transcontinental flights are killer.) We had a nice rest, and then went out to explore. The reception area was staffed by friendly, knowledgeable, helpful people the whole time we were there. They usually knew which room was ours before we asked for the key. The breakfast was superb. We arrived in Venice for the first 3 days of our 14 day European tour, and I wish this had been last, it spoiled us for the rest of the hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Im_a_happy_camper41
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Would definitley recommend. Venice was fantastic and this hotel certainly added to the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: “stylish hotel in great location with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: three-go-everywhere
Reviews.Content: Just around the corner from the Accademia Bridge, this hotel is in great location for exploring Venice. Although we were there at the end of Carnivale, the rooms were very quiet. Front desk staff were charming and helpful. They made restaurant reservations for us on both nights and recommended good bars and interesting walks thorough the city. Can't comment on the hotel restaurant as we preferred to have breakfast in the local cafe and the bar was closed during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel in the best part of Venice”
Reviews.Author: sjlovelly
Reviews.Content: My fiance took me to this hotel for a weekend break. The staff were really attentive, the room was cleaned twice a day, and it was a treat to come back in the evening and discover a box of chocolate truffles awaiting us. The shower was amazing, and the bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was included and was very tasty. The hotel also has a turkish steam room you can request the use of which was a nice way to relax. The hotel is in very close proximity to Le Academia and Peggy Guggenheim Collection, as well as being close to a good selection of local well priced restaurants. Would stay here again if we go back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to tour venice from.”
Reviews.Author: mustb5star
Reviews.Content: I do not know where sydneyseasons stayed. It wasn't at the Ca'Pisani Hotel where we stayed for our honeymoon. The reception staff were multilingual, informative, and accommodating. There is free wifi, the breakfasts are plentiful (italian bacon, cheeses, cereals, fruits, yoghurts, dates, toasts and spreads, eggs, need I go on?), the rooms are art-deco with great room service and a turn-down service. The restaurant provides great food which is well priced, and the bar is sensibly priced for Venice. We loved the turkish bath on the third floor - perfect after a day's walking around Venice. Different cultures WILL do things slightly differently and the Venetian way is certainly not the Aussie way... I would heartily recommend this to anyone who wants to see Venice as it is just off the main tourist thoroughfare but only a few minutes walk from everything and the service is awesome!!!!! Tip - avoid the gondolas - Incredibly expensive, and guaranteed not to be rowed by an Italian!

Reviews.Title: “I have finally found a home in Venice”
Reviews.Author: monchef
Reviews.Content: Travelling to Venice often over the years, we have never really ventured out of a property off San Marco, but after reading the reviews, I just had to try it out. Ca Pisani is a gem of a hotel...right off the Academia, a skip and hop to everything, yet away from the madenning tourist haunts. I contacted the hotel late November as we were finalising our trip to Europe, and emailed Tommasso, and he immediately got back to us. As we were travelling with our nephew, we were looking for a triple - something quite unusual specially in the smallish rooms for Europe, and with a great rate, I bagged it. I was expecting a dorm type set up -- but I was pleasantly the surprised. The room was akin to a junior suite, with an anteroom for the sofa bed, a B/O television and high ceilings. Modern italian is best to describe the room....A sliding door separates the bedroom -- with a lounger and a armoire for the tv, fridge and the writing desk. The bathroom has a walk in dresser, and even had a jacuzzi tub and multi jet showers...amenities are by Lush. The breakfast room buffet, managed by Paolo, was simple spread, but the attentive service was just fanstastic, specially in a jaded town like Venice teeming with photog tourists. Arrangements for transfers -- they offer a meet and greet service at a small premium and restaurants are just perfect...one night, we came back late and wanted a bite, and they pointed us to Acqua Pazza -- one of my best meals in Venice to date. By and large, I have become a convert. Ca Pisani makes you feel at home....check them out.

Reviews.Title: “The best Hotel in Venice in every aspect!”
Reviews.Author: efal
Reviews.Content: This was our best choice for accommodation in Venice. Based on TripAdvisor reviews we chose the Ca Pisani as a minimal and stylish Hotel to spend our New Year's Eve. The site is superb and the photographs are exactly what you see is what you get stuff. We were amazed by the concierge service (they brought us boots for the rain upon request and at a reasonable price of 30 euros), their friendliness and hospitality, their excellent English (not all italians speak English, unfortunately) and last but not least the fantastic breakfast, with scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages, hot croissants, fresh fruits, yoghurt, a large selection of breads and jams etc., all in excellent quality variety and portions. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recomended”
Reviews.Author: chrisadi
Reviews.Content: when luxury and art come together, you have Ca'Pisani. About 50 steps from the La'Academia. Surrounded by restaurants and galleries. Value for money.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: CassCade
Reviews.Content: My husband booked Ca'Pisani for three nights in September to celebrate our tenth wedding anniversary. He had heard about the hotel from his sister, who had stayed there with her husband and heartily recommended it. She said it was "the only place to stay in Venice!" The holiday was a complete surprise for me until the week before we went and it was only after we arrived that I realised he had booked Room 30, featured in Conde Nast Traveller magazine as the most romantic room in Ca'Pisani. This romantic feeling was certainly enhanced by the complimentary bottle of champagne that the staff provided on our first evening, which we drank while watching the sun set over Venice. (Yes, really, it was that romantic!) The whole hotel was fantastic; beautifully and stylishly decorated throughout, with friendly, helpful staff. It is very well placed to see all of Venice, with just a two or three minute walk from the Accademia Vaporetto stop. Our room had a large window that opened onto a view of the Venice skyline and that was fantastic enough, but we were also woken each morning by the melodious bells of the nearby Church of Santa Maria...a lovely way to wake up, I can assure you. After the days' sightseeing, we went up to the hotel roof garden to relax on the sun-loungers in the evening sun, serenaded by the church bells and looking out over the city rooftops. As part of Hotel Ca'Pisani, the downstairs La Riviera restaurant serves delicious lunches and a full choice at breakfast. One top tip is to buy a two day/three day/ whatever length of stay pass for the Vaporettoes, you will find it good value for money! Also, make sure you do at least one night journey on the Grand Canal - you will see a whole different side to the city. Our stay in Venice was a fabulous break and I would throughly recommend Hotel Ca'Pisani to anyone who asked me where they should stay in this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel in quiet but central location next to the Academia”
Reviews.Author: plkmtk
Reviews.Content: This was third stay at the ca' Pisani. The rooms, ewhole not huge, are very well-appointed and clean, the service is excellent and the location can not be beat-central but away from the madhouse of Rialto and San Marco

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, almost at foot of Accademia Bridge”
Reviews.Author: StamfordRaffles
Reviews.Content: Having booked into 'disaster hotel' and found suite we'd expected not available we check on line for something else, found Ca Pisani and and went down to take a look. They handled us wandering in off the steet wanting to examine their rooms with great aplomb! A suite wasn't available on the first night so we had a largish room on the mezzanine floor, which was prefectly good and elegantly/modernly furnished, and checked into a suite the next day. The suite was a working/sitting area and an open sleeping area above. The see-through glass stairs to the bedroom were disconcerting at first, but we quickly got used to them. The only glitch was the room was very hot, so my wife went to reception who sent someone up, who told us the heating wasn't on as air wasn't blowing out of the grill. We said we knew it wasn't, the grill was simply hot. (The heating is centrally controlled, which makes sense in an old building with limited scope for air-conditioning). He then told to us contact either maintence or technical (can't remember) next time we had a query. The exchange left a bad taste. That said, we opened all three windows and cooled the upper room down that way; and the rest of the staff were fantastic, the hotel is very cleverly converted to combine an old building with modern touches, and the location is ideal. There's even Zaterre vaproetto stop at the end of the street, with a pick up point for taxis or the blue line to the airport. Love it, intend to go back to Venice and this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Third Visit at My Favorite Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ChuckC
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit in three years to the Ca'Pisani. This hotel has everything going for it and is a wonderfully relaxing home away from home for visitors to Venice. While not cheap (we paid E369 for a deluxe room) prices include an excellent European/American breakfast complete with freshly brewed espresso, cappuccino and filtered coffee; meats and cheeses, cereals, eggs and bacon. The hotel is located on a street that is within a block of the Academmia Bridge where the Venice public water taxi makes frequent stops. The hotel' is a "10" on the interior design scale: its public spaces are filled with modern art that is beautifully juxtaposed against other textures such as natural brick, marble, glass, leather. The staff at the reception desk are uniformly friendly, well informed and eager to assist guests. We look forward to returning to this hotel many times in the future.

Reviews.Title: “What a great spot!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerDallas
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very nice spot near the Academia Bridge. The hotel is small and quiet, just away from the bustling part of the city. The staff was very helpful, recommending a restaurant that turned out to be our favorite dinner spot. The hotel appeared to be newly redone, an interesting combination of the old and the new. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “the ca'pisani was great but!”
Reviews.Author: lindagailhowell
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from venice staying at the ca'pisani for 3 nights. I travelled with my daughter who was recovering from a spell in hospital. We were very impressed with the hotel when we arrived, cleanliness and amenities were great. I think it would have been better to stay on any other floor than the mezzanine as unless we has not walked up the stairs to the terrace we would not have seen the lovely art deco funiture on the other floorsThe largest fault we found was that on more than one occassion when we came back at night we could not get a nightcap in the hotel, one night at 10.20 pm we asked for a coffee and were told NO. such a shame not to be able to sit in the little lounge and have a drink before we went to our room! We did not find the concierge particul;ary friendly or helpful just perfunctory (usually) NO answers.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful contemporary hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewMexicoSW_Traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights in Venice at the end of July 2009. The hotel was very clean, beautifully decorated in a modern, contemporary style. The location was pretty good, but a little hard to find at first. However, the staff was professional and completely courteous at all times. The hotel was very well kept, the room was beautiful, clean, very stylish, and fairly large for a Venice hotel. The air conditioning worked well, the bathroom came with a jacuzzi style tub and was beautifully decorated. A very generous and beautiful breakfast comes with your stay. We were very glad that we chose this hotel and would highly recommend this one again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: justfrank
Reviews.Content: Ca' Pisani is a very nice hotel. We stayed in a superior room, which was pleasant and spacious. The people at the desk are friendly and helpful (we wanted pizza in the room one night, so they pointed me to a good place that did take-away and then gave us plates and cutlery). The air conditioning was good the bed was fine and there were curtains and electric shades and electric Venetian blinds so the room was quite dark enough. There were lots of available electrical outlets, a rarity. Aside from breakfast (which was fine, though the servers seemed constantly overwhelmed, even when there were few people), there is no real food to be had in the hotel. Overall, I think everything is attractive, but sometimes overdesigned. There were probably 25 things that looked like light switches, but only about half of them were (several were for the electric window coverings). The door handles were beautiful, but the Do Not Disturb signs don't fit over them. The shower has 4 different controls for a total of 6 showerheads and a handheld sprayer. The desk was interesting-looking, but not functional. Nothing really bad, just minor annoyances. The location is terrific and a big part of the appeal. It's an easy walk to most of the sites and it's convenient to multiple water bus lines. It is also in a quiet, pleasant neighborhood, with very little tourist traffic and a great waterfront walk with restaurants and gelato places within a couple of blocks, and there's a nice supermarket about 10 minutes away. This is a major relief from the hoards of people in Venice during the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Just like the reviews promised”
Reviews.Author: Herodotus_II
Reviews.Content: We came to Venice for a long promised short holiday for my wife's 40th birthday. So we researched extensively all the possible places we could stay (and in case anyone is in doubt, tripadvisor is the place to find out). We chose Ca' Pisani on the strength of the reviews, but particularly the consistency of the those reviews. We didn't want to be surprised or end up writing one of those reviews where we were the "unlucky ones" whose experience was the exception that proved the rule. This is where Ca Pisani excelled - we got exactly what we had hoped for. The location is first class: close to everything and yet just far enough from the crowds to feel relaxing at the end of the day. When booking we asked for a room on the top floor and there were no mistakes. The room was very comfortable with good air conditioning and we had large windows with a roof-top view. Breakfast was fine; continental only and we had the option of sitting inside or outside on the pavement. The front desk where polite, friendly and helpful. So in summary, with Ca Pisani you will get exactly what the reviews promise, which in our case was exactly what we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Ca Pisani is the perfect home away from home in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: DesignTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at Ca Pisani at least half a dozen times and it consistently matches, or exceeds, expectations. The fabulous design and intimate scale of the hotel are perfect, as is the location, but it is the truly warm, welcoming and helpful staff that make the visit exceptional. The front desk staff will treat you like important guests in their homes, making sure your needs are met, all with great humor. Fashioned out of an old Venetian house, impeccably remodeled in Art Deco style, the 30+ rooms offer a range of sizes (and prices) depending on your needs (housekeeping is excellent as well). An included buffet breakfast, free wifi and international newspapers completes the picture. The location, just across the Academia in Dorsoduro, can not be beat - close to everything but away from the crowds. Having just returned we are ready to go back NOW!

Reviews.Title: “Art Deco gem”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTravelmum
Reviews.Content: In 6 previous trips to Venice we had always stayed in the San Marco area and on the Grand Canal. Ever since it opened a few years ago, however, I've kept an eye on the Ca' Pisani which was the first "design hotel" in Venice, and situated in the Dorsoduro area (sestiere) near the Accademia. This trip, staying 8 days, I convinced my husband to take a chance and try the place. We loved it. We enjoyed staying in Dorsoduro and found the place just about perfect for our needs and our tastes. I find the "opulence" of everything Venetian gets a little heavy after a while--in a hotel room, at least. Furnishings are often gold embossed or trimmed velvet or damask, usually in dark blue or blood red. After just so much of that I begin to fear that the heavy drapes will fall on me. I like the clean, modern look found in design hotels. Ca' Pisani delivers on clean and design though the look is retro Art Deco rather than modern. That's more than ok with me since Art Nouveau and Art Deco are my real favorite design eras. This place pulls out all the stops on Art Deco. The public rooms and spacious hallways are filled with lovely pieces and some of the "art" is designs of art deco furnishings. No expense has been spared to make things look very authentic. Check the hotel pix on the Expedia site (which I think are the ones you get to when you click hotel pictures on this site) and you will see an example of a guest room door with its inlaid multii-colored wood designs. It's that kind of a place. This design theme carries over into the guest rooms. We opted for their standard double. It is not pictured on the Expedia site, being smaller than the rooms shown, but it certainly provided ample space for us and seemed larger than most Venice standard doubles in my experience. The furnishings in our room were also a bit darker and heavier than those shown in the Expedia pix, so if you crave light and airy this may not be the place for you. I'm going to try to attach pictures we took of our room and bathroom to provide some idea of what I'm trying to explain. The bedding was pleasantly modern, light weight, and comfortable. (I would love to have taken the crisp, cool, lineney sheets home with me) The mattresses were firm, very much to our liking. The bathrooms were spotless and kitted out in brownish marble with flecks of sparkles, and beautiful, streamlined art deco plumbing fixtures. Our room had a jacuzzi tub--and a window to let in some light. Actually our room could be very light and airy in spite of the heavy furniture when we opened the lovely--light weight--drapes over the two windows. One faced the mini-palaces on the other side of our street which cuts across the Dorsoduro from the Grand Canal to the wide Canale de Guidecca. The other, amazingly enough showed a view down that street to the Grand Canal where we could see the water traffic traversing it. So, it turns out that we did, after all, have a Grand Canal view, if a bit distant. The young folks at the front desk (I think the average age of the clients of the hotel tends to be younger than many other hotels in Venice) were very helpful, did all the standard things, like getting us dining reservations, arranging a water taxi to the airport, etc, but did so with what seemed to be real concern and interest. They provided excellent suggestions for dining when I had a couple of free spots on my dining card. In fact one of the places, L'Avogaria, tucked away in the Dorsoduro section but an easy walk, was among our top 3 dinners of our trip. The single exception to this cheerful service was the staff in the breakfast room who were helpful and efficient enough, but just a little glum. Breakfasts were buffet style, included in the reasonable rate, and quite ample, good and varied--sliced meat, fruits, cereals, pastries, yogurt, etc. The usual spread, but generously provided. The restaurant serves both in and outside and has snacks during the day and bar service though they do not serve full meals. We enjoyed the Dorsoduro area. It has a slower, less frenetic pace than San Marco, fewer hordes of tourists, almost no pigeons, and even the presence of real Venetians going about their daily lives. There was an elementary school just a little ways down the street from the hotel. The hotel is only a block or so from the Accademia vaporetto stop, so we were able to get easily to all but the most out of the way places. We booked through Booking.com which came out to be about 250 euros average per day for our 8 day stay from late May to early June, though the daily rates varied from 220 to 264 which may have been caused by different rates for days of the week as well as a change of month in the middle of our stay. Whatever, we felt the experience was certainly "worth it" and will certainly choose to stay at the Ca' Pisani the next time we're in Venice. They don't cater to business travelers as such, but do have wi fi available and I did see some guests who appeared to be there on business. Also saw two extremely well-behaved pre-teens in residence.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Brighton_Uk_Mae
Reviews.Content: My husband and our two children came across this hotel by chance. They were extremely accommodating - wonderful with the children and very helpful. My family praised its cleanliness, modern design, and the substantial breakfast. Although somewhat expensive, my husband had looked at other hotels in the area and they did not meet the standard of Ca'Pisani and were either comparable or more expensive in price. It was the highlight of their 2500 mile journey through Europe.

Reviews.Title: “I really liked this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JuanitaDallas_Texas
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind not having the old world decor, this place is over the top wonderful, in my opinion. The staff were helpful and top-notch. The rooms were extremely comfortable and attractive. I loved the beds and bedlinens, pillows, etc. It was the best nights of sleep I had during our three week vacation. The location is good and accessible to the hot spots without being in the thick of things. Quiet and soothing to come home to and I did feel "at home" at Ca'Pisani!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with xcellent staff”
Reviews.Author: OVERSEAER
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first time...will return to this hotel whenever I visit Venice. Small hotel with great staff offering good overall value. It's not cheap but you get good value for your money. I recommend this hotel for business or pleasure. BTW there's an excellent restaurant located opposite th hotel...one of the best in Venice...a 30 Euro menu to die for!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in every way”
Reviews.Author: SueHWhitleyBay
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 nights at this lovely hotel. It is in a fantastic location, central but away from the crowds. The decor is superb and the staff are wonderful. We have been to Venice many times as it is our favourite city and this is by far the nicest hotel we have stayed in. It was our anniversary whilst we were there and we had taken our cards which the staff must have seen and when we returned that day there was an ice bucket with a bottle of prosecco. We took it up to the rooftop to drink - a lovely touch! We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect bolt holt for busy Venice”
Reviews.Author: SuzyMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Ca'Pisani was our second choice but I am so glad we stayed there. The location just 2 mins walk off the Academia vaporetta stop was perfect. It was central yet not smack in the crowded area of St Mark's. Hotel room was actually decent sized for Italy and hot breakfast was a nice inclusion. Would highly recommend it for people who like modern furnishings in a convenient location in Venice. We stumbled upon a wonderful concert just across the bridge one night (Chiesa di San Vidal), which just added to our wonderful Venice experience. PS: make sure you get across to Murano esp. if you like jewelry!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, tasteful hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: yearabroad
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. Fine attention to taste, design and details throughout. Excellent location, close to everything, yet slightly out of the crush of the tourist hubbub. This means it is quiet and relaxing. The employees went out of their way to help us in every way. The owner is a Masters Swimmer, as am I, and she introduced me to her Venetian swim club with which I trained.

Reviews.Title: “Stupendously Good!”
Reviews.Author: OtterAbroad
Reviews.Content: Ca Pisani is everything you hope for in a hotel - good location, beautiful decor, comfortable bed and absolutely outstanding staff. Easy to find, this lovely hotel is completely decorated throughout in Art Deco style - every detail is beautifully included. If you just admire a hotel for it's stylishness, you will be impressed, if you personally like Art Deco you will be delighted. The hotel has a small steam-room which can be booked and a roof-top terrace with views across the terracotta roofs of the city. The staff at the hotel, from the extremely helpful Thomass in reception, to the shy girl who made the best coffee we had tasted since arriving in Europe 5 months ago, were without exception, outstanding. It was no trouble to recommend good local restaurants, give directions, make reservations, you name it, it was done with a friendly smile. The food at the breakfast buffet was very nice, so nice we returned and had something from the small 'snack' menu at lunch time. We enjoyed the luxurious surroundings and wonderful furniture of the Junior Suite and it was a pleasure to return in the evening from a day's sightseeing to find the room clean, with chocolates on the pillow. There was a small sitting-room area, and the bathroom had a large separate shower, plus a marble bath/jacuzzi and toilet + bidet. We also asked to view a standard room, and although this did not have the separate shower, it still had the fabulous marble bath/jacuzzi, so we believe the standard room would be just as enjoyable. We would without hesitation, stay at Ca Pisani again, and have already recommended it to several friends who are planning a visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mariacristinaRome
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure to stay at ca' pisani with my husband 3 weeks ago and we really enjoyed our stay. nice location: downtown but at the same time out of the crowds, wonderful staff both at reception and the restaurant, and original decoration. the hotel is member of 'design hotels' and they do have pieces of furniture and decor form the forties, along with modern technology like (free) wi-fi connection in all the rooms. we will suggest this little nice jewel hotel to all our friends! (and we will hopefully be back soon)

Reviews.Title: “Quirky Good, Quirky Bad”
Reviews.Author: GibberishCali
Reviews.Content: Interesting hotel, but some quirks that I trust have been worked out since our stay. Upon check in, we went with the bellhop to a room that had other guests staying in it already--it was an awkward situation. We went back down to the lobby and were reassigned another room, which was nice if not unremarkable. Later that day, we took some friends to see our room (they were staying next door at another hotel) and all 5 of us got stuck in the elevator for over an hour! After we were unceremoniously released from our prison, all we were offered was one beverage from the bar and a very terse apology. Mind you, this was in the middle of summer and it was disturbingly hot in there... We also didn't have a lot of time to spend in Venice and it took a solid chunk out of our stay there. Lastly, in our shower, the odd 'designer' soap dispenser that had no soap in it. We had to call to get it filled with some strange powder. Perhaps this too has changed since... Awkward moment when my wife had to wait in her bathrobe while staff came in to refill the dispenser... These quirks added up to an experience that was a bit strange and off-putting, but I wouldn't expect everybody to have the same experience--perhaps bad luck on our end. I just regret that they weren't as apologetic as I would have expected for the elevator mishap and didn't offer us anything besides a luke warm drink and apology. I don't know if it was worth spending the money that we spent, but it was an experience nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent services, meticulous interior design, very central.”
Reviews.Author: ALECHAN
Reviews.Content: This elegant hotel has struck me for the original touch in its interior design which totally agrees with the style of the old palace or 'house' it occupies ( the 'Ca' of the name means 'house'). Not only is each room differently furbished with original antique, modern and conteporary pieces, but also each room's door is different and designed specifically for the hotel. The choice of each piece of interiors is well informed and done with great taste. In addition the service is very professional, the staff kind and available to help at any moment. The internet connection was very useful and I loved to be at the very centre of Venice, so I could go back to my room as many times as I wanted during the day. Highly reccommended!

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel and we had a lovely time.”
Reviews.Author: JulieGolding
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and we had a lovely time. Would thoroughly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Returning To Venice”
Reviews.Author: Chaz_8
Reviews.Content: On arrival we purchased a return ticket on the red line of the water buses, quite slow, took about 1 hour and 20 minutes and cost 50 euros for 2 return tickets. It will pay you to research your trip as to how many times you want to use the water bus service and purchase a 48, 72 hours etc. travel card. This will save you in the long run, we got off at Zattere which was a 4 minute walk to the hotel (excellent). Hotel very friendly on arrival, room spacious and clean, shower brilliant 5 heads,1 on top and 4 down the sides, although toiletries sparse, no small bottles but hair and shower gel (together) in container (take your own). Takes about 20 minutes to walk to St Marks and Rialto Bridge. Research restaurants as all seem expensive due to weak pounds. Would highly recommend Dona Onesta in Dorsoduro excellent , friendly and reasonable. Took up the complimentary Muriano trip from the hotel, good trip but can be daunting as the glass is expensive and you are shown around it with the guide, just be honest if you don't want to purchase and then look around Mariano Island. You can use the computer and printer at the hotel which is great for online checkin. Buffet breakfast very good, lots of variety. All in all a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Were won over by the boutique Ca'Pisani”
Reviews.Author: EmmalinaSemolina
Reviews.Content: As Venice has so much to offer we wanted a hotel which was convenient, friendly, not stuffy but which in this City wouldn't cost the earth. The Ca'Pisani was great - and since then I've also arranged for my parents to stay there too and they were equally enchanted. It's got a great location, stylish and good-sized rooms and common areas. The restaurant and bar is small but very good quality - modern Venetian food and excellent breakfasts. The staff couldn't have been more helpful (including sourcing wellies to cope with unexpected (to us) flooding). It's small enough to feel personal but not so small that it doesn't have all the amanities and to a high standard.

Reviews.Title: “My Favourite Place in Italy”
Reviews.Author: Aleshel
Reviews.Content: We stepped off the Vaporetto at Zattere around midnight in the sweltering Venetian heat. The short walk to the Hotal Ca Pisani was magical and as we stepped through the beautiful entrance into the icy cool reception moments before we melted into the grand canal we were greeted by name by the always friendly and welcoming staff. My daughter (Age 5) and I were shown to our room (number 8) and after much delight with the fish shaped door key, were enchanted by the mini suite with glass staircase and mezzanine floor. We took a jacuzzi in the glittering bathroom before retiring to sleep feeling like princesses. Venice is one of the most beautiful places in the world, and Marianna and the staff at the Ca Pisani enhance the experience for me every time I visit. I have stayed there several times and would never stay anywhere else. The hotel is filled with beautiful Italian vintage furniture pieces carefully chosen to compliment some very modern Italian touches and some excellent examples of contemporary art. Extremely stylish, interesting and comfortable. There is a lovely secret terrace upstairs with a fantastic view of the Venetian rooftops and the hotels central location makes it ideal for sightseeing. Considering all it has to offer I think it is very reasonably priced. A very special place.

Reviews.Title: “Old Venice mixed with botique design”
Reviews.Author: SeraBey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in May of 2008. We did not make plans to stay here, we didn't like were we were staying, so we just walked into the hotel to inquire if they had rooms for the next 3 nights. They made us a very good offer (which often happens with walk-in inquiries) - about 1/3 less than what they normally offer and they gave us a tour of rooms they had available. We were very impressed and not disappointed with our decision. We had a double standard room, which was spacious, well appointed with a comfy bed and sheets and large bathroom. As others have said, the location is fantastic. The hotel location is close to the vaporetto stop (city water bus), museums, shops and restaurants. It is also in a more authentic, local, district - away from the hustle and bustle of the over-run tourist district. Around the corner is one of 2 special shops called DITTURA GIANNI (on Campo San Vio) which make the traditional gondolier velvet slippers and other hand made sandals with bicycle tire soles. There are several things that make this hotel stand out - its mix of old and new Venice atmosphere - the beautiful contemporary Venetian glass sculptures in the lobby- the breakfast- but the most memorable aspect of the hotel was the terrace. We usually had it all to ourselves. We would have afternoon (room-service) expresso here (along with pastries we would pick up on our morning outing) about 5:00 each afternoon. We would hear the church bells ring and watch the sun set over the Venice roof-top skyline. Charming and romantic!

Reviews.Title: “Staff is very customer focused and accomodating”
Reviews.Author: mueller_luedenscheid
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Capisani Hotel. The place is truly unique and the staff particularly accomodating. Leading up to our arrival we were constantly kept up-to-date about the weather situation and the staff responds promptly with reliable e-mail follow-up info on any issue you may have. We felt very well taken care of and will surely be back during spring time. The Hotel restaurant was under reconstruction but we got a referral to an excellent nearby place even with a discount voucher. Besides, the location near the Zattere water taxi is particularly convenient. We will be back soon, definetely !

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay despite the flood”
Reviews.Author: talkative
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Ca Pisani & we had a great time. Check in was warm, friendly & efficient and the reception staff continued to be helpful & pleasant the five nights we were there. They were particularly pleasant & patient on Monday 1/12 when the worst flood in 20 years meant we couldn't leave the hotel till 2pm & everyone was getting "cabin fever". Our room was spacious & comfortable - the high ceilings & large windows give an added sense of space. The bed was very good. House keeping is very good. The hotel is decorated with real flair. It's in a great location. Our only disappointment was that La Rivista restaurant was not as good as before. Staff were good the food was just not up to the previous standard.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Goncalo2008
Reviews.Content: The Ca Pisani is one of the best small hotels I have experienced. I stayed a few nights in room 11 and loved it: it was quiet, cosy, well appointed and large, with a wonderful bathroom. Since I am very much interested in Art Deco, I was delighted to see all the furniture pieces in the hotel. The location is good: you can either walk to the centre or take the water bus in the nearby station. In the neighborhood you have the Gugenheim museum, the Accademia (Accademia ) and several interesting shops selling art. The staff was frindly and helpful. This is definitelly a hotel that I can endorse and where I would like to return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Crystal231
Reviews.Content: We loved the Ca Pisani. The lovely room, luxurious bathroom, excellent setting - quiet, but within a few minutes walk of the Academia waterbus stop/bridge. My only gripes were the basic hairdryer and lack of luxury bath products - perhaps no women are in management here?! Would definitely stay here again. Oh, and try the hotel's restaurant - we had the best food of our stay here - the risotto with seabass and lime was superb! Really friendly restaurant staff and they gave us a discount/free drinks each time we ate here because we were hotel guests. http://www.restaurantlarivista.com/

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place!”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveler01048
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ca' Pisani recently and had an excellent stay. The location cannot be beat. The rooms were great. The bathrooms are in top order. The staff was always very friendly and courteous and spoke excellent English (and Italian with our daughter). The breakafasts are very nice. Prices are reasonable, considering it's Venice. A real gem.

Reviews.Title: “Way too expensive”
Reviews.Author: Trinaca
Reviews.Content: Quite disappointing place to stay in, we imagined the hotel would be more modern and quiet...forget room nbr 25 as the bed head sits just next to the neighbours jacuzzi and its so damn' noisy when you're trying to sleep!! At night we couldn't leave the window open because of the aircon's engines sitting on the other roofs...and since there is no control switch for the aircon in your room you have to ring the reception every time. Also the rooms on 3rd floor (nicer) should be avoided in summer because it gets sooo hot!! same for the terrace. Don't expect much will be left for breakfast if you turn up after 930am, they don't seem to refill!! The service was rather cold, just polite but nothing more, which I find scandalous considering we left over 500 euros for 2 nights there, and that was a discounted rate!!! Definitely poor value.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: robierobierobie
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend at the Ca Pisani in their Jr Suite, which was absolutely wonderful. The hotel is within walking distance of all the main interesting places in Venice. The hotel itself is quite and very nicely decorated. The personnel was very friendly and willing to help out at any time. I would defenitly recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ambersyard
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, great service, perfect location! Had spent hours and hours checking out hotels in Venice for a 2 night stay for a 40th Birthday treat. Eventually through lastminute.com, booked via their 'top secret' facility (you don't know where you will stay until you pay thus receiving a discount in price). Ca Pisani had been on my 'possible' list so was pleased when the confirmation came through. The staff have an excellent level of service and so friendly. The rooms are immaculate with all the trimmings you would expect (and want) from a top-end hotel. The breakfast is fresh and more than enough with the addition of fantastic coffee! The location was a definite plus plus point. Having travelled around the city, we were so pleased we were in the Dorsoduro district. the hotel is a moment from the main water bus stops which is a must for getting around and for taking in the city from the water. (tip - do buy a travel card which lets you hop on and off boats at your leisure). Do go to Ca Pisani - you'll love it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Ca' Pisani”
Reviews.Content: I booked the Ca' Pisani for a special family occasion which coincided with Carnevale. The hotel was lovely and the service was fantastic - very friendly, responsive and genuine. Although Venice was teeming with people, and the hotel was well located, it never felt crowded. I have recommended the hotel to all of my friends and am very much looking forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing hotel find in Venice”
Reviews.Author: quakerhill
Reviews.Content: Authenticity. Sometimes you find a hotel or restaurant that's so wonderful you don't want to tell people for fear of it being discovered. Well, I'm wanting to share because my spouse and I enjoyed an amazing time at Ca' Pisani during our Venice adventure. Let the place be discovered. It's perfectly located near Peggy's (the Guggenheim, that is) off the Acadmey Bridge. The breakfast great. We loved the the deco antiques in the room and public spaces. The art blew us away. Italian Futurism to the max. Any hotel that has a Depero in the lobby is okay in my book. We got great, friendly personal service from the various concierges and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “very stylish hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: HurtyFeet
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a couple of nights in July. It was very easy to find and close to a Vaporetto stop. The hotel itself was stylish with very pleasant rooms and cool air-con which was appreciated as Venice is very hot in July. Great location for all the sights - St Marks is within walking distance and the Vaporetto stop is just round the corner. Breakfast was tasty and the bar was a nice place to hang out before going to dinner. The Art Deco look was a bit different to your average hotel and made the place seem even more stylish and special. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: England34
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a wonderful location down a quiet street but a short walk from Zatterre and Accademia vaporetto stops. The bedrooms and bathrooms look like they have been recently refurbished and the bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. We ate in the hotel's restaurant La Revista on our first night and had a very good meal. The only slight downside was the lack of hot water. We stayed in room 19 on the second floor for 3 nights and were without hot water on two occasions. Having said this, the staff were quick to sort out the problem each time, and our friends in a room on the floor below had no problems at all The staff were always keen to help, ringing the water taxi company several times on our behalf to sort out departure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: buscadora
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to stay at this hotel after reading many reviews, and I agree with all of its strong points. The staff at the desk were excellent; they all seem to be willing to answer our questions, help us make dinner reservations, and find our way around. The location was perfect: both in regards to access from the water transportation and for walking to many excellent sights that were nearby. It was also blissfully quiet, a real asset on such a busy weekend. The breakfast was fine, and the bar a pleasant place for a before or after-dinner drink. Unfortunately, we didn't get the opportunity to eat dinner there. One thing that was very disappointing to me was that our room was overly warm, "stuffy" being the most apt description I can think of. The first night I called the desk to see how we could turn on the air conditioning, and I was told that it was something that was controlled centrally, not in our individual rooms. So we opened the windows wide, turned on the bathroom fan, and managed to be comfortable, except for battling a few mosquitos. On subsequent days we tried to keep the sun out during the afternoons so that we didn't return to such a warm room. The first day, the housekeeping staff opened them; the second, my husband didn't put the blinds down properly. Every day, trying to make the temperature in the room comfortable became our endeavor. In short, I didn't expect this to be an issue in a hotel of this standard. Coming home with mosquito bites is okay for a camping trip, not for a stay in a pricey hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ca' Pisani in Venice - Great Staff and Great Room!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerRalph
Reviews.Content: We had a truly magical stay at the Ca' Pisani in the Dorsoduro district of Venice. Originally we were only booked for one night, but decided at the last minute to splurge and stay here two nights. The staff couldn't have been more accommodating and helpful. They gladly showed us a couple rooms. The location was PERFECT, far enough away from the crazy crowds of San Marco, but only a 1 minute walk to the Accademia Bridge and waterbus stop. We found the Dorsoduro district charming, artistic and a great value for shopping and eating. A wonderful district to get lost in and still easy to find where you need to be. We ate all our dinners on nearby San Barnaba Steet. The building is beautifully maintained and decorated with a fantastic mix of old and new. Outstanding art everywhere, from the entry way, lobby, hall rooms and on every floor. I found myself going to every floor so as not to miss anything. Our stay included a complimentary Turkish steam bath, which was clean and very relaxing. Breakfast each morning was fantastic, the best we had had in 2 weeks in Italy. Fresh fruit, pastries, eggs, meats, cheeses, juices, and delicious coffee with steamed milk made to order. The room had enormously high ceilings, it was a true oasis. Everything was modern and in perfect working order. Once the door was closed, we couldn't hear the outside world at all. The bathroom was a joy, specially the shower and separate tub. The front desk staff - Casimo and Franco were terrific!!! They couldn't possibly be more helpful, cute, funny and charming. They gladly helped us with everything from shopping tips, restaurant choices, transportation, museums - everything. The entire staff was fantastic, and most spoke English. We were so sad to leave, the thought crossed our minds to skip out on this whole work thing and stay in Venice. The Ca' Pisani was a real gem!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Ca'Pisani”
Reviews.Author: SteveTait
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights here in FEB. The location was terrific, central to everything. The staff were extremely helpful and welcoming. Our room was large, well designed, modern and had a great bathroom. We took advantage of the hotel's winter package which included a dinner at their restaurant, Le Revista. It was one of the best meals we had in Italy so we highly recommend this package. Breakfast was also served in the restaurant and was again one of the best breakfasts we had in Italy. The hotel also had free web access on a public computer which was very convenient for us as we had to check on some business while in Venice. The hotel is filled with great art, much of it fanciful and fun. All in all the hotel had a great "vibe" without any attitude, which is what we were looking for. Also, don't miss the Peggy Guggenheim Museum. It was wonderful and the tickets were included in the hotel's winter package.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: smithsr72
Reviews.Content: I researched where to stay in Venice and found this hotel over and over. We booked it and absolutely loved it!! The space in the room and bathroom was rare for a european hotel. The ambiance was fabulous. The restaurant was great. We were traveling with our 10 month old and the entire staff was great at helping us maneuver with her. I also loved the lush bathroom products so much that i asked what they were so i could get them myself!! The location was also fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and charming location”
Reviews.Author: Paulklib
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 nights at Ca'Pisani. The hotel is in an ancient building, totally renovated, perfectly clean and decorated with pre-40's furniture and fine modern carpets; the ancient volumes have been preserved. Our junior suite was large enough, and absolutely quiet. There is no view, our windows opened on the wall of the adjacent building; this is not a disadvantage in the winter when the sun raises late and guarantees a total silence during night; you may sleep there with open windows. Moreover, a canal view is nice, but it comes with the noise and smell of water traffic, which is a pity in a city without cars. Very well equipped bathroom : bubble bath and separate shower; no trace of the flodings mentioned in another ecent review : closing properly the shower door protects you froma private acqua alta. The reception staff is very knowledegeable and helpful, and advises you well on restaurants and shopping. The place has a small restaurant, with reasonably good food and a good selection of wines. The only weak point is the breakfast : service is minimalist, no fresh fruit juice as a standard proposition and the scrambled eggs are kept on a heating device and are overcooked. As a whole, an excellent experience; I would certainly recommend the place to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon at Ca' Pisani”
Reviews.Author: kat517
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I decided to get married in Venice. This romantic city was the first stop on our 10-day honeymoon. After an extensive Internet search we booked a 2-night stay at Ca' Pisani for the nights of November 11 and November 12, 2007. The hotel was well worth the cost. It's located a stone's throw from the Accademia bridge, close to the vaporetta and not that far of a walk from St. Mark's, the Rialto and the post office. Located in Dorsoduro, it's away from the swarms of tourists and loud crowds. The hotel is modern and well-decorated. Our room was warm, spotlessly clean and comfortable. Although we didn't eat dinner at the restaurant on the first floor, the breakfast was wonderful, with various meats, cheeses, eggs, cereals, juice and milk. It was a vital part of our morning. Additionally, we had a nice drink there. The mini-bar was fully stocked. A computer with Internet access was available and there was a small roof-top terrace. We loved our Venice wedding and our stay at Ca' Pisani. We'd love to return someday.

Reviews.Title: “Service, Service, Service! What a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_the_world21
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from celebrating my 3rd year anniversary with my husband in Venice. We stayed at the Ca Pisani Hotel and it was Fantastic! The hotel is lovely, love the decor super modern equipment, electric blinds, very high tech - they offer wi fi in every room and a computer is above reception in case you do not travel with your own. The hotel is not brand new but is very clean, but what makes it wonderful and a trully worth stay, is the quality of the service! We received a 5* serivce from the minute we made our booking and got a written reply by the wonderful Franco. He and his team, the guys from the resturant Manieh and Alfredo who were endlesly patient with my very poor Italian! ensured we had a wonderful time. They gave us excellent recomendations every morning on activities, made reservations for us at great restaurants, I could go on forever. Upon our arrival, we had a complimentary bottle of Champagne chilled waiting for us as we had mentioned we were coming for our anniversary, we were trully touched by this gesture. Anyway, the hotel is located in a fabulous area of Venice, near loads of galerias and churches and perfectly close to public transport. There is twice a day a cleaning serivce and a turn down service at night, with delicious chocolates on the pillow and everything! I must confess I did wake up every morning to the chatter of people passing by and the church bells. I think this is very common everywhere in Venice due to the nature of their buildings, our room had extremely high ceilings and hence very large windows, that although double glazed due to the closeness and design of the streets do not isolante the noise entirely...but for us it was not really a problem. I am such a fuzzy person when it comes to the places I stay, I was very pleasently surprised by the Ca pisani and if I return to Venice I intend to pay them another visit. I woudl also like to say their restaurant La Rivista serves fabulous food, and as well as the Hotel the service is second to none! Alfredo and his team know how to make you feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Good city center hotel”
Reviews.Author: andy_horsham
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the junior suite for 3 nights. The suite consisted of a king sized bed, separate lounge, bathroom and wardrobe cupboard, two TVs and a built in sound system. Room was very clean, quiet, far enough away from the canal not to get any noise from boats (which is a problem I had last time I stayed in Venice). Wasn't a fan of the bathroom - looked amazing, but the floor got very wet after showering, meaning if you wanted to go to the toilet you needed to put shoes on or get wet feet. Bathroom was well equipped - separate shower cubicle, jacuzzi. Although I didn't like the toiletries, they were manufactured by LUSH and smelt horrible!!!! Breakfast was reasonably good, not a vast selection but certainly enough, and all of very good quality. Probably better than you would expect from a hotel of this size. The location of the hotel is amazing. 10 minute walk to Saint Marks square, but in a slightly quieter area. La Rivista - the hotel's restaurant, is also amazing. Staff were friendly, hotel has got a good internet point (only 1 though) and a little roof terrass should you fancy a spot of sunbathing! Overall - a nice hotel. Would I stay here again .... not sure, probably unless I could find something better. The only reason I wouldn't stay is because of the bathroom, specifically the flooding!!!

Reviews.Title: “This is a fabulous bijoux hotel a haven from the bustle of Venice”
Reviews.Author: LaurenWLondon
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous bijoux hotel, with beautiful rooms. You feel you've stepped into a Hercule Poiret film set with all itâ€™s 1930â€™s splendour. The bathrooms are luxurious in marble. The restaurant is lovely, with great food. The hotel staff couldn't have been more helpful, with amazing restaurant recommendations. Just perfect for a romantic get away with one you love.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: minniemouse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ca Pisani recently for the second time. We stayed in a junior suite, which was very spacious and beautifully decorated. The sheets are soft. I couldn't get a feather or down pillow. Small detail, but pillows are important to me. The room was full of electronic gadgets, a Bang and Olufsen stereo, 2 TVs, electric shades and blinds and multiple lighting options. I was surprised to find that they still have wall mounted hair dryers which are very weak. It seemed out of place in a huge granite bathroom with a jetted tub, a towel warmer and a separate shower and bidet. Bathroom amenites included a sewing kit, detergent and a clothes line, emery board, q tips, but there was no body lotion, and the shampoo/body soap was in dispensers in the shower and bath. It had patchouli in it, a scent that I'm allergic to. I was glad I had brought some shampoo and conditioner along. The restaurant had great food and service. The breakfast buffet was very nice. They had a big selection of fresh food and good coffee. The location is great, near the Academia Bridge. The Dorsoduro area is a great neighborhood. It's quiet, residential and you can find local conveniences like supermarkets and restaurants with reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Weekend in January”
Reviews.Author: tealight
Reviews.Content: The weather was cold - the month was January but this hotel and the staff were fabulous. The restaurant/bar was pleasant and entertaining and the staff was just great. IF you are looking for a great hotel in Venice - slightly off the beaten path but in a great location - this is for you! Art Deco touches - lovely decor - just wonderful. And it is fun to go even if traveling alone!

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit as good as the 1st”
Reviews.Author: lippincottfarm
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our second visit to this wonderful hotel. Our room for this trip was a junior suite which was well appointed and comfortable. It was fully handicapped accessable (I am not handicapped) and I would think that anyone who has mobility problems would be very pleased with the set-up. As before, the king sized bed was well appointed and comfortable. The bathroom was large in size, clean and easy to get around in. We had one large sink, an open shower, tub, toilet and bidet. There were two closet areas, a nice sized livingroom with two chairs and a coffee table. The tv received CNN and the BBC stations. Breakfasts are generous with delicious food. We ate dinner here one night, and the food was excellant. Franco, who works at the front desk is friendly, helpful and pleasant. This is a wonderful hotel with a great location. Plenty of restaurants within a short distance. I would stay here a third time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Phoebe059
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is located in the relatively quiet Dosoduro section with easy access to 2 vaporetto stops: Zattere and Accademia. Our room, number 25, was small but comfortable with good air conditioning. We liked the modern (1930's) design but the period headboard squeaked and groaned loudly when anyone sat up in bed and the light for reading was not adequate in the area set aside for chairs. The staff was very friendly and helpful, getting us tickets to a nearby concert of music by Vivaldi in Chiesa San Vidal and restaurant reservations. The on-site restaurant La Revista offered a very nice breakfast buffet (the best we had in Europe) and the wine and cheese bar had a wonderful if limited selection of menu items. After a large lunch one day, in the evening we stopped in La Revista where I had a selection of 5 local cheeses that was superb. We would definitely stay at Ca' Pisani again on our next rip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Achiever”
Reviews.Author: RodMaxwell
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Ca'Pisani as one of our honeymoon destinations based purely on Internet research, including feedback on TripAdvisor and the friendly assistance we received when we called the hotel to make some enquiries. Having not been to Venice before, it was a small, but well rewarded leap of faithâ€¦ on the hotel and its location. Caâ€™Pisani is truly lovely hotel; contemporary in style yet warm and inviting. The facilities were excellent, the service (especially Marianna) was always courteous and helpful, the restaurant was a standout in a rather hit and miss market and the location was quiet yet still close to major attractions. Be sure to try the cheese platter! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Venice- Stunning boutique hotel with Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: civetta11
Reviews.Content: What a GEM! Ca' Pisani well exceeded our expectations all around. The decor is very sleek, contemporary with funky 1920's details dotted around this exquisitely-restored palazzo. Our standard room was spacious and bright, with super comfortable beds & luxurious linen. The wholesome breakfast was something to look forward to in the morning; and the stunning roof terrace was a great place to chill out after a day amid the madding crowds around St. Mark's Sq. The staff were great and informative, with Franco in particular who stood out as highly-efficient, dynamic and professional. During our stay, he provided us with exceptional service and always with a smile. This has made a real difference to our stay. In one instance, we had left it late to book our airport transfer but he managed to sort it all out and even reconfirmed everything on his own initiative. Such attention to detail and conscientiousness are rarely seen these days. Well done, Franco- you have made our stay at Ca' Pisani a true delight and we are recommending your charming hotel to all our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Just super”
Reviews.Author: DoublinPair
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful base from which to see Venice. The art deco interior is cool and fun and the staff could not be more helpful. It is just 10 minutes walk from St Mark's Square, a stone's throw from L'Accademia and Zettare vaporetto stops, yet is on the quieter side of a very busy town. It has a simple but good restaurant and once again the service is truly excellent. The rooms are large, wonderfully furnished, and a great change from most other hotels around the world. Amazing bathrooms. If we go back to Venice we will stay there again. Nothing could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Asia2005
Reviews.Content: With so many average hotels in Venice, this one is absolutely beautiful and cool. I know they have different rooms (some really nice and some of them small) but in general the atmosphere, the staff and the location are perfect!!The only average thing is breakfast.More of a 2 stars hotel...I totally recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again at this boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelswithboys
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms to accomodate our family. Rooms were modern, clean and had beautiful linens. The complimentary breakfast was delicious. Some rooms are noisier than others. We loved the Dorsoduro location. The touristy St. Mark's Sq. was a short walk - we felt lucky to stay in our own private Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer101673
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a trip to Italy this past week. What a wonderful country. Our first stop was Venice where we stayed at the Ca'Pisani hotel. The hotel is not in the main touristy areas (Dorsoduro area) however with a very short walk to the vaporetto and took less than 15 minutes to get to any of the main spots. After spending 2 days in Venice we were relieved at the end of the day to walk to our hotel that was on a quaint, quiet street. The hotel gave us a warm welcome and even gave us an upgrade to a different room that had an extra room with a couch and TV. The room was modern, bathroom smaller than normal (but nothing to complain about) and everything was very clean. We stayed in room #10 which was a short walk up the stairs (or elevator) and not on the street front. I was disappointed with the all inclusive breakfast however staying in two additional hotels afterwards, we learned this is the European way. The hotel offers free internet which was great, recovering from jet lag I would use computer early in the morning. Daniel, a front desk clerk was very helpful, offered me coffee and a crouisant one morning while I was working at computer. I am a very picky person and this hotel was excellent and couldn't be happier that it wasn't in the Rialto Market or San Marco areas. The hotel is on the same street where at the other end is the Zattere which is great for watching the sunset and having gelato.
