When you arrive in Venice take your own water taxi arranged at the airport, they will hopefully drop you off at the Accadamia Bridge (a vaporetto stop). When you get off, go around the to the left, walk up the street (1 block) and hotel is on your right. Very short walk and you will have all of your bags! Wondferful hotel, thank you for making our stay in Venice wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Room in an Otherwise Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: profpsg
Reviews.Content: No supposed four-star hotel should assign guests in their 60's, as we were in April, to a room ten yards from the reception desk and directly over a loud restaurant open early and late. The so-called mezzanine rooms are incredibly noisy and a good night's rest is impossible. We were moved to another room on our third night, but this room, too, was noisy.While the hotel had other positive features, our stay was badly marred by this situation.

Reviews.Title: “Great art deco hotel”
Reviews.Author: recentlyinItaly
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. It was comfortable, sleek, modern, and tasteful. The location was great -- away from the crowds and easy walking distance to the sights. There was a good selection for breakfast. The staff was wonderful and very helpful. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wrldtrav
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific contemporary/art deco Hotel. We stayed for 6 nites and were sorry to leave.The rooms were modest size but normal for Venice. Great bathrooms.Good breakfast served in their restaurant or outside under an umbrella. They have the best front desk staff that we have found in Italy...they are young, energetic and helpful, that includes Franco, Marco, Sergiu, and Georgio.They even made some dinner resies for us in Tuscany because the hotel there couldn't be bothered to help us!The location in Dosoduro couln't have been better. No canal view, but easy access to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Terrible Bed”
Reviews.Author: Columbray
Reviews.Content: We are a middle-aged couple who just spent two weeks in the Veneto including three days in Venice. We selected the Ca'Pisani because of its great location in a quieter part of Venice (Dorsodoro, near the Accademia bridge) and because we liked the modern design. Overall, the hotel is quite wonderful - great service, excellent design - EXCEPT for one problem - the matress on the bed was as hard as a rock. We both ended up with sore backs. If a super hard mattress is not an issue for you, then we would definitely recommend the Ca'Pisani as a base for exploring Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: cottonstones
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days at this hotel. The hotel is well located in Venice and convenient for using the water taxis. We had room 31, a large superior double. The bed was a little hard but adequate and a good size. The room was a decent size with views over the roof tops. The bathroom was a little on the dark side and had an unpleasant smell in the corner near the toilet which we mentioned to reception on our departure. The electric switches controlling the lights and blinds in the room were confusing. Breakfast was good with fresh fruit, cold meats, eggs, cereals, tea coffee etc. The service was friendly and prompt. The staff on reception were very helpful. Overall, this hotel is good value for money and it's position in the city, whilst not on the main canal, is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: Claire33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ca Pisani for 2 nights with our toddler and although it would not immediately seem like a child friendly hotel we were pleasantly surprised. The room was great, nice modern decor as opposed to the heavy gold and silks of most top class Venice hotels. The front desk staff were extremely helpful (even telling us that BA had rerouted our flight before BA had bothered to tell us!). The location is perfect slightly away from the crowds but still close enough to walk to all the main attractions. Just behind the hotel was a great Ristorante - the San Trovaso - where we had an amazing dinner for very little and with all the locals queing up for dinner at 9pm on a Sunday night!!! Our only negative comment would be that our room (no 1) is quite noisy being situated at the top of the wooden staircase that everyone passes by to get to their rooms, and from where you can hear the reception desk phone everytime it rings (from early in the morning to late at night). The music from the restaurant below also goes on till late but when we pointed it out they turned it off so no complaints there!!.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: elsanesta21
Reviews.Content: my wife and i have just returned from a weekend at the ca pisani. this was my wifes 40th birthday present and wanted it to be extra special. the transfer from treviso airport to the hotel took about 35 minutes. we were met at the airport and after being told we would be picked up in luxury we were greeted by a miserable man in a decrepid people carrier.some luxury ! we were then put onto a private water taxi which took about 4 minutes and when we arrived at our destination we were told we would be met by a porter to take our luggage to the hotel but no one was there although only a few hundred meters away we didint pay 195 euros each way to have to walk with our own luggage and find the hotel. when we arrived the staff appologised and took of 10 euros .WOW ! we opted for room 31 which was tastefully decorated but the lighting was poor,far too dark, the jacuzzi bath didnt work which was a little dissapointing.we were told that champagne would be in our room upon arrival which it wasnt and had to ask several times before it was finally done. the staff were generally pleasent although the maids did make a habbit of entering the room without knocking first and just walked in on us. the worst aspect of this small boutique hotel occurred once my wife and i had checked out. we arrived back in the u.k and 2 days later i received an email telling me that i had been charged 145 euros for breaking a silver cotton wool box in the bathroom. my wife made a point of moving this box out of harms way as she had her own cotton wool and did not need to use it. the manageress had said that the maid had found it broken to bits and accused my wife and i .i sent an email back saying that i was appalled with the accusations and demanded a full appology and refund of the 145 euros and that maybe just maybe the maid might have broken it. the second email i received was as good as calling my wife and i liars. alledgedly this is not the first time this hotel has tried this scam and i will be pursuing this to the bitter end. i believe for 375 euros a night there is a lot better out there. my advice would be to steer well clear of this "hotel"

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: CareyH
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3-night stay at Ca Pisani. A very stylish, boutique hotel. The room (we had No.1) was great and staff very friendly. Breakfast was simple continental style. There's a small roof terrace on the 3rd floor - nice place to get a different view of venice over the roofops. There's also a turkish steam bath, although I didn't try it myself. Location-wise - the hotel is only 100 metres from both Zattere (where the airport ferry stops) and Accademia, handy for any of the Vaporetto going along the Grand Canal. The location is also well situated for wandering the craft shops of Dorsoduro and only a short stroll over the Accademia bridge to San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: John_Dickie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Vencie in late January and stayed at the Ca Pisani for three nights. The hotel is first class and in a really good location (unless you are determined either to overlook a canal or be in St Mark's square) convenient for anywhere you will want to go and a five minute walk from the airport water taxi stop. We stayed in room 30 (at my request) which gets a write up in the press section of the hotel's website and has high ceilings, good views over the venetian rooftops and a wonderful bathroom, with an enormous bath. Breakfast is included and is served in the hotel restaurant. While not the enormous scale buffet of some large 5*s it was more than enough for our needs -- very good homemade fruit salad, cerials, cold meats, cakes and hot food too. We did not eat in the restaurant which I thought a little too cramped to be ideal for dinner -- but you can see for yourself at breakfast. At the moment they have a special regional menu on Fridays. Would strongly recommend and the hotel website has some package deals worth checking out before booking -- at least at this time of the year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and great location...”
Reviews.Author: TrishBrady
Reviews.Content: Just back from a great trip to Venice. Stayed in the Ca'Pisani and really enjoyed it. Staff were really helpful, rooms were wonderful. Husband made use of the jacussi bath and loved it! Breakfasts were yummy... all in all we had a fantastic time. We were even given a little box of chocs on Valentines Day! Booked it cause it was a design hotel as we have stayed in some of them before and it didnt dissapoint. The room was beautiful (a bit small but it was a standard room). The details in the room were fab, bathroom was the highlight! Its in a lovely area too, no too touristy but just a 10 minute walk to San Marco. Lovely restaurants in the area and great for strolls. Zattare area is fantastic, we strolled along in the sun eating ice cream it was pure bliss! One word for your arrival into Venice... pay for a water taxi! We got a water bus and it took almost 2 hours! Nightmare or what... thought we would never get off it. We then would have had to transfer to another one to Zattare but decided to walk the 10 mins instead. We got a water taxi back and it was worth the 85 euros as we got back in under 20 minutes. Other reviewers have mentioned the bus to Pizzale Roma and then the number 1 water bus which might be okay but if you want to get to the hotel quickly and start your hols a taxi is your best bet! Have fun its a fantastic city!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: schnauzerlady
Reviews.Content: We are another LuxuryLink Success story. We decided to visit Venice in December because my husband was shy of keeping his gold travel medallion on our locally-based airline. Going to Venice gave him exactly the 50,000 --not one more or one less-- miles that he needed. I then began checking for a hotel. I thought the reviews for Ca' Pisani here on TripAdvisor were quite good, especially compared with the hotel's price. Also, we'd already taken 7 trips through LuxuryLink , through which we found the hotel listing, and had been pleased with all. Once again, we were not disappointed. First, the hotel is incredibly easy to reach. Just take the airport water bus --12 Euros pp versus 90 Euros per water taxi-- to the end of the line and walk about 2.5 blocks. Second, because it is close to the Accademia bridge, it is easy to reach almost anywhere in Venice by foot (and my husband is 79). Third, it is just enough off the beaten path that there are many good restaurants nearby that cater to the locals as well as serious tourists. Fourth, the rooms are quite nice -- not sheer luxury, but much more than acceptable. The bed was especially comfortable., and there were two TVs with cable . Fifth, the breakfast was more than standard -- warm eggs and bacon as well as the standard meats, fruits, cheeses and rolls; we ate twice in the restaurant -- the 2nd time was better than the first as we knew what to order; however, the first was quite acceptable. Sixth, and perhaps most important, the staff is incredibly helpful. There is someone on duty 24/7 -- something one does not always find in a boutique hotel. We also appreciated the free wifi -- although it did have the bad habit of timing out just as one was in the process of composing a complicated email. We also had a free daily paper. In fact, one thing we liked very much was that we were not constantly "nickled and dimed." Everything was included -- and that included service. No hands held out for payment for delivering luggage or serving meals. How refreshing! My only complaint --and this shows how successful the hotel is overall-- is the light switches. I counted 28 in our room .. and I probably missed a few. FIguring out which switch governed which light took a bit of time. And it took us several minutes to figure out how the controls for wonderful whirlpool bath were operated --- it was only when we found the master switch behind the door that we could get it to work. I am sure we could have called the front desk to ask for directions --but given their emphasis on service, we would have had an in-person visit, and we weren't exactly dressed to receive visitors. As for other items, the rooms were spotless, the water was always hot (we had a junior suite, and the shower was so fantastic that we almost ignored the tub) , the robes --and towels- were deliciously soft, and the toiletries --including shower caps-- were refreshed daily. We would not hesitate to stay at Ca' Pisani again .. and would recommend it to our friends. PS: Mid-December is a wonderful time to visit Venice. The Venice tourist agency indicated that the week before, there were an estimated 42,000 rooms booked in the area; our week (December 10-16) there were fewer than 8,000. We walked right into the "Behind the Scenes" tour of the Doges' Palace --during tourist season, one is advised to book between 2 and 6 months ahead; we had no waits at restaurants; we had the churches and museums almost to ourselves (in fact, our Christmas card featured a picture of the nave of Fiari with not an individual in sight). Perhaps we were just lucky as we had no rain (and sun almost every day). The walk platforms were out but not yet in use, and our plastic boots went home unused. Also, before you go, try to read ""Beware of Falling Angels." If you starting reading it on the plane, you will get very little sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Stands out from the crowd”
Reviews.Author: snowyshome
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Christmas 2006. Hotel is easily accessible, being only 100metres from Zaterre on the water bus route from the airport. The immediate vicinity is quiet, but only a few minutes walk from Academia bridge, which gives one of the best views of Venice. Reception staff always extremely helpful, friendly and not overly formal. Helped book rail tickets and restaurants and couldn't do enough to help. We booked a superior room which overlooked the quiet street. The decor was as described on their website, contemporary with great attention to detail. The bathroom was nice, including jacuzzi bath, the only criticism of that is that it was pretty small, but very clean with all amenities. One of the best points of the room were the electronic shutters and blinds which could be operated from the bed and made the room completely blacked-out. The maid service was great and included a turn down service at night. Breakfast was served in La Rivista which is the hotel restaurant. Breakfast was nice - not the best buffet I have ever seen but perfectly sufficient and the restaurant is quite funky. Lovely roof terrace (bit cold in December but would be great in the summer!). In terms of location, it is pretty quiet and about a 15 minute walk to St Mark's Square, however we did find some nice local bars and restaurants which were much less touristy, cheaper and better quality than the tourist traps of St Mark's.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Link Venice Style”
Reviews.Author: Bcr8tve
Reviews.Content: June 2006 - stayed for 3 nights in Ca'Pisani. The concierge arranged a boat to Murano free of charge, went beyond the call of duty to successfully resolve a charge dispute from a glass company. REstaurant has excellent food - full european style breakfast. Upscale room interior with all granite walls in bath & bidet. Small scale but first class. Eat gelato everyday and try the local wine $5 bottle at neighboring restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lippincottfarm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for three nights in June. We are planning on coming back next year. The hotel is great, and I was surprised to read the post about the maintenance. We found the hotel to be in great shape with a very comfortable bed. In fact, the beds are my pet peeve with foreign hotels generally having only a mattress, no box springs, so they are as hard as a rock or if old, saggy. This hotel had neither. The hotel is modern in furnishings, but as long as you know this ahead of time, it's no surprise. The staff was very friendly and helped me with my Italian. The restaurant had the typical European breakfast. There was plenty to eat. We ate at the restaurant one night. The food was great, and the staff went out of their way to make the meal enjoyable. Cheese tray for dessert was awesome, with glasses of port. What a way to end the evening. The bathrooms are not the typical little European size. Large and well appointed. Both a bath and shower. Two tvs in the suite. Windows really open. It is in a great location with neighborhood restaurants all around. We walked all around and never felt unsafe. ATM very close. Vaporetto stop within a two minute walk. If I had to be a real nitpicker, the only complaint was I forgot my adapter plug to use my dual voltage hair curler, and called down to ask if there were any in the hotel, or if there was some place close by to buy one. Front desk promised to find out and call back, but no one did. Husband said I didn't need one, I looked great with my straight hair, so he earned brownie points. Other than this one issue, the stay was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Quite frankly, the best hotel we visited in Italy!”
Reviews.Author: bhoak
Reviews.Content: Our first stop in Italy, in August '06, was Venice- Ca' Pisani. We had a superior room on the top floor and loved it! The bed was wonderfully comfortable and I'm very picky. The bath was fabulous with a skylight over the shower/tub. Two comfy chairs rounded out the room. It was all we could ask for. The breakfast was excellent. I'm amazed at anyone who says otherwise! We also had a dinner in the restaurant which we enjoyed. We found the front desk service occasionally brusque, but no more so than in other Italian hotels. Location was stellar. I greatly look forward to my next stay at Ca' Pisani.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but....”
Reviews.Author: welltravellednotts
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the end of a 3 week trip around Italy so were quite travel weary so I think that maybe we didn't see the hotel as anything spectacular, in fact compared to others we stayed at it needed a really good clean. The fixtures and fittings were wearing a bit and were in need of sprucing up. Our room was a superior which was a good size but the bed was really squeaky and uncomfortable. However the staff on reception were very friendly and helpful and the location is great as its near the Accademia Bridge and away from the main busy areas around St Marks and the hotel is on a quiet street.. We didn't eat in the restaurant but people said it was good, however the breakfast was pretty average. For the price, compared to other hotels in Venice its fine and we have no major complaints, but we dont have anything majorly remarkable to say either.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Venice; Great location”
Reviews.Author: dpnyc
Reviews.Content: Venice hotels are dizzyingly expensive. We thought the Ca'Pisani was a great value overall. The standard room was very small but functional. Furnishings and bathroom were relatively modern and a bit funky/trendy. We loved the location. Convenient (10-15 mins walk to Piazza San Marco or to the Rialto) yet not in the midst of the enormous volume of crowds right near Piazza San Marco. Also not quite as overly touristy as the San Marco area can sometimes be in its shops and restaurants. The breakfast was excellent -- lots of options. Our only complaint was the front desk. They were willing to suggest restaurants and book a few things for us, but they did so in a way that made it seem like it was a bit of a bother to them. Definitely not the warmest or the friendliest.... They definitely detracted from our experience. In sum, this has value (relative to Venice prices) and location going for it, plus it's new-ish, unlike a lot of the more traditional Venice hotels. We had a comfortable stay and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SFAnne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the Ca' Pisani through Expedia and were suprised to get a rate of $207 a night for a standard hotel room in August. The hotel is in Dorsoduro, right next to the Accademia and the Guggenheim. It was a terrific location for August when the San Marco square is overwhelmed with tourists. The Dorsoduro is a bit more quiet than the center and has more charm, but it's easy to get to San Marco - you simply cross the Accademia bridge and walk for 10-15 mins. The Ca' Pisani was everything I had hope for. It's a small design hotel with lots of charm. The standard room is small, but the bathroom was a decent size, which is often not the case with European design hotels. The pillows and bed were comfortable and the sheets were simple white cotton. The hotel staff was very nice and accomodating, helping us with restaurant reservations, and the usual silly questions. The complimentary breakfast offered anything from bacon and eggs to pastries, but it was the multiple cups of coffee with perfectly foamed milk that made it a delight. Especially, since we could enjoy them at a table outside on the street people watching. I highly recommend this hotel and will try to always stay in the Dorsoduro when I visit Venice in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: WoodyB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Venice many times and decided to stay in an area we have not explored. The Ca' Pisani Hotel in the Dursoduro area is easily reached by water bus/taxi from the airport - just a few minutes walk from the Zattere stop. The hotel is close to the Accademia museum and bridge. The hotel isn't the usual musty Venetian style but rather art deco and modern in decor. The small restaurant downstairs was excellent for dinner and had more than an adequate breakfast. We were very pleased to find this small and pleasant hotel and would stay there again. We appreciate the reviewers comments on Trip Advisor's site. Thank you - Travelers from Amelia Island, FL.

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel but enough to discover Venice”
Reviews.Author: ADLN
Reviews.Content: I spend 4 days in this hotel, and really is a good option in Venice. The famous hotels are really expensive, and this give you a great price (is also expensive, but is Venice, so....), for a design room. I had not been before in Venice so I think this is the best option for a novice. I suppose that in other visits to Venice y try to go to a hotel that introduces me something more in the venetian history. The hotel is designed like a modern one, then, when you have been captivated by the venetian atmposphere, it's is possible that you prefer a classic one. The worst of the hotel is the breakfast... very poor. The best: the hotel is in Dorsoduro, so you can go to a walk and discover the real Venice, where the authentic venetian people live. It's a very calm hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An eyeopener of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: buv1955
Reviews.Content: I kept this hotel a secret from my wife and what a surprise she got when we arrived. The room was superb, a split level suite with the bedroom upstairs overlooking the living area. The bathroom was state of the art with walk-in power shower, jaccusi bath and every possible accessory included. The hotel is brilliantly sited near the Accademia Bridge and in a very quiet street so outside noise was not a problem. The breakfast was more than adequate and catered for all tastes. One word of caution would be the noise from floors above as the wooden floors didn't muffle the sound of the occupants too well. Try to go for an upper floor if possible. Check out the roof top terrace which was a delight. The hotel also boasts a fitness room and steam room but we didn't use these facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cbspuches
Reviews.Content: just got back from a trip and during it i stayed at ca'pisani for 2 nights. my wife and i loved it. if you are into great design, you should definitely consider this place or even if you stay somewhere else, come to ca'pisani and look around. it mixes old and new, art and function, and the service is 5 star. our room was very spacious, brand new big bathroom with a real jacuzzi tub, sitting room with daybed and tv, and master bedroom with desk and chairs. it was like a modern italian apartment. taste-wise, it hit the mark. but if you are looking for something more standard, like a hyatt or hilton tyoe room, this is not it. there is free wireless internet in your suite, and if you dont have a computer there's one in a private area with a printer. breakfast was nice--for americans, there's more than just the continental fare. eggs, bacon, etc. the location, i thought, was great. its not right in the square like the other big, famous venice hotels, but with the crowds there this was a blessing. it was nice to return back to the quiet street the hotel is on after the sheer volume of tourists clogging the main areas. but the best part of ca' pisani is the service. when i left, i was about 2 blocks away when the front desk girl chased me down to let me know i left something in the room. it was just headphones, the disposable airline ones, but still. i appreciated it. great hotel, i will come back for sure. i am into hotel design to i took pics of my room, check them out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, but very quiet area.”
Reviews.Author: Albie44
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Ca Pisani from the 8th July for a three night stay. Overall the hotel was above average. Having read all the reviews before departing the bedroom was exactly as we expected, beautiful. The only main problem we had with the hotel was it's lack of bar facilities and the fact that the restaurant was not even open two out of our three nights there. The sun terrace was a lovely way to unwind in the afternoon after walking all day and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Monkeychillo
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Caâ€™Pisani at the beginning of our honeymoon in Italy & we could not have been happier with our experience. The hotel is perfectly located, an easy walk to all the sights & restaurants, yet nestled on a quiet & peaceful street. The decor is unique & lovely with a mix of modern & antique with a lot of art deco. There really is a lot of attention to detail everywhere you look. Our room was beautiful with a fantastic animal print rug, mirrored armoire/desk & a great view of neighboring courtyards & balconies covered in bright flowers. The bed was very cozy with crisp linen & feather pillows. The bathroom was incredibly spacious & luxurious, with a jacuzzi tub, separate shower, & gorgeous marble, tile & fixtures. The breakfast buffet is great & the tables out in front of the cafe are a lovely spot for a drink in the evening. The staff was amazing, so welcoming, helpful & friendly. They helped us arrange a guided tour, dinner reservations at a restaurant they recommended which was delicious, train tickets, & a boat to Murano, & answered all of our many questions with professionalism & warmth. Every single person we interacted with was great. Our stay really was a wonderful experience from start to finish & we highly recommend it to anyone planning a trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing in a Couple of Crucial Ways”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are bewildered....why -- even after paying over $400/night for a hotel --were we in a state of perpetual discomfort our entire stay? Why was this a problem in a hotel of this quality, when it is possible to go to any inexpensive hotel in the U.S. and be completely confortable so that one may actually sleep well? This hotel had the potential to get a rating of "excellent" from me and my husband, except for these two crucial problems: the air-conditioning didn't work very well, and it was somewhat noisy. First, the unit is positioned so that the only cool air that blew into the room (f.y.i.: Room 27!), tended to slip through the door into the closet area (we had a "superior double"), instead of circulating in the sleeping area where our bed was (there was absolutely no vent or a/c in the bathroom, so you got this stuffy, steamroom effect if you kept the door closed when showering). When we asked the Manager, who was helpful in every other way, if there was a way to get the a/c down lower, he came into the room and proceeded to tell us that the reason why it seemed warm in there was due to the high humidity in the Venetian air (Hello? We've been living in Mississippi for the last 3 years, people, so I think we're familiar with humidity, and if your a/c works the way it should, you'll be cool, and even cold if you want to be, no matter how muggy and hot it is outside. It was only in the 80's in Venice when we were there anyway). He did offer to change our room, but insisted that the temperature was the same in every room in the hotel. (We later noticed it was cooler in the common areas of the hotel, however.) We did think that this might be the case, that all the rooms were about the same temp, since it is Europe...and since we had already unpacked, and we were absolutely exhausted from pulling the all-nighter, transatlantic flight anyway....we stayed where we were. The a/c unit also produced a light rattling sound, which sometimes would sound as though someone was typing on an old typewriter in an adjacent room (a typing ghost). In retrospect, we should have changed rooms, but I think by the time we figured out that was what we should do, it was almost time to leave. I think the hotel was great in every almost other way. The location was excellent, especially if you wanted to be close to the art museums and St. Mark's square. The breakfast was very nice, especially if you're American, and you enjoy scrambled eggs and sweet cakes, etc. in the morning. The style and the decor of the hotel was particularly remarkable, with an effort to expose some of the traditional features of the building, while decorating in the Futurist style. Our tub set-up left a lot to be desired, though. We had this large piece of immovable glass in the middle of the tub (like a shower door that had been slid into the middle of the track and could not be moved) and you had to climb around that and into the tub to shower. Between that & the very high sides of the tub, I'm not sure whether an elderly person could manage. I personally found it impossible not to get the floor soaked every day. The maid service was very good. I think I would be very careful not to get Room 27 if I chose to stay here in the summer!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a trip to Italy and this hotel was outstanding. In a beautiful but quiet area of Venice, yet near all the main attractions. The hotel was very unique in its style as was the staff in the quality of their service. The restaurant provided an excellent breakfast and the hotel truely was a part of a great experience in a terrific city. The rooms all had great attention to detail and were very very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A+++++”
Reviews.Author: LEMV
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great time. This hotel is wonderful! The design is very unique and beautiful. We would return in an instant. Thanks!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having visited a number of ultra-modern hotels, the Ca' Pisani really does top them all! The decor was absolutely stunning and breath-taking with a mix of ultra-modern, art-deco and 17th Century features. The hotel is absolutely gorgeous and conveys a sense of warmth, romance and coziness many industrial designs miss. I had a standard room which was absolutely perfect. The room came with lots of state-of-the-art features as well as an oversized art-deco bed. Everything was top-quality and had been fit to the room. The bathroom with its separate jacuzzi tub and shower was beautiful. Everything was so gorgeous and relaxing that it was hard to motivate to get out and see Venice. From start to finish, the Ca' Pisani experience did not disappoint. Service went above and beyond and was very friendly. I speak Italian but they dropped into English for my convenience and returned to Italian when they realized I actually wanted to use my language skills. They eagerly helped a friend rearrange travel to the Treviso airport when he missed the airport bus. And they went the extra step in helping me arrange transportation to the Marco Polo airport for a 6:30 AM flight explaining all my options, making reservations on my behalf and then going the extra step of inquiring about a wake-up call. All requests were met with genuine enthusiasm and friendliness. The location is also ideal as it is in the quieter Dorsoduro just over the Accademia bridge. It's very easy to locate and the neighborhood is less packed with tourists but easily accessible to San Marco and the primary shopping streets. The Guggenheim and other museums are just around the corner. The Ca' Pisani is not inexpensive but is one of the few times when I've felt like a pricey hotel truly delivered in terms of service, rooms, location... basically everything. My only regret is not being able to stay longer! The Ca' Pisani would be great for honeymooners and romantics of all types. Singles wishing to travel in style would also genuinely appreciate the place and friendly service. It's warm-modern approach is a wonderful alternative to more traditional Venetian hotels. I have been to Venice a number of times and look forward to returning to the Ca' Pisani.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kenbong
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a beautiful boutique hotel. My wife and I booked our 2 night stay in a standard room over the Internet and were quite surprised at how nice it was. The room had a huge queen bed with that modern, minimalist styling everyone is doing these days. Some cool features about the room: roll up blinds, venetian blinds, radio, and lights all wired up and controlled by switches at your bedside, oh, and the bathroom had to be one of the largest I've ever been in - waterfall style shower, side jets AND a handheld spray wand. Marble/limestone tile all around - just amazing. In the reception area, there are one or two computers with free Internet access. Also, the map which the hotel gives out is far superior to any of the other free tourist maps. Just ask the front desk. A few navigational things - we actually got lost walking around looking for the hotel so I'd like to share a few pointers. You can actually access the hotel from two vaporetto stops. If you're travelling through the Grand Canal, you'll need to stop at the "Accademia" stop. Once you get off the vaporetto, you should be facing the Gallerie dell'Accedemia with the Accedemia bridge behind you. If you walk to the LEFT of the Galleire dell'Accedemia, and continue along the street, you'll eventually hit Ca' Pisani. Alternatively, you can also get off at the "Zattere" stop (which is on the outside of the island) and walk to the right a bit, and then up Rue Antonio Foscarini (I think this is the name of the street that Ca Pisani is on). Some other things - the hotel is in the Dorsodouro area that the hotel is in is nice and quiet, and within walking distance of all major sights (~15 mins walk to Piazza San Marco - just follow the signs). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Ca'Pisani”
Reviews.Author: MFar
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. It is very modern. Our room was spacious and had two full bathrooms. The people at the front desk were very helpful. They gave a lot of good recommendations for restaurants. The only negative (which to some people may not be a negative) is that it is not on a canal. Hotels on canals can be noisy. This hotel, however, is only about a minute walk from the Grand Canal. It is in a great location. I would highly recommend this place to anyone staying in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stylish Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in mid April, just before Easter. Originally booked for only 4 nights, we added a fifth because we didn't really want to leave. We were extremely impressed by the friendliness of the front desk staff, the lavishness of the breakfast, which was included in the room tariff, the comfort and size of the room (we had a junior suite), and the stylish modernity of the furnishings. We had wanted to avoid the Venetian gothic of so many of the hotels we searched on the web, and we extremely happy to find the 20s and 30s Futurist ambience of Ca Pisani. We would recommend this hotel to everyone who enjoys comfort, style, convenience, and a warm welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked Ca'Pisani by e-mail - it was so easy they replied by return - nothing was too much trouble for them. It was a surprise trip for my husband's 50th Birthday and I wanted everything to be perfect - and it was. It is a stunning hotel - our room was a standard double and the attention to detail and the bathroom were just amazing. We found all the staff to be very helpful and polite. The position of the hotel was we thought the best for exploring Venice. We absolutely loved it. The roof terrace was great too for relaxing after a busy day. We didn't eat at the Hotel in the evening but the food looked great, breakfast was a buffet and had a good selection. We ventured into Harry's bar for a Bellini - very expensive! I would definately recommend Ca'Pisani. We had a wondeful time.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel on internet and their welcoming emails and offer of assistance was very reassuring. Arrived in early March to a wet horrible evening in Venice. When we arrived we were welcomed and upgraded to a Junior Suite and dined at the hotel. Food and wine fantastic (and reasonable) we struggled to find better thought our stay. This hotel is a Gem and cannot speak highly enough. every aspect was a joy, staff friendly and dÃ©cor superb. Room was lovely with its Tangerine leather chair and silver guilt case goods. Bathroom was vast with Jacuzzi bath and party size shower Only down side is that the hotel doesnâ€™t really have a bar. There is an area to the front of the small restaurant, but it appears an afterthought. However, no problems having drinks served in lobby/lounge area. Situated right behind Academia and in a quite area of Dorsoduro. Short walk to Peggy Gâ€™s. gallery which is a must. Also Ai Gondolieri restaurant just a short walk which was superb. (donâ€™t be intimidated by menu â€“ just ask. We watched lots of people ordering risotto as it was the only thing they recognised on the menu and were too â€™Britishâ€™ to ask. After all the average reviews for most of Venice hotels I wonâ€™t consider staying anywhere else on my next visit. Hotels like this make travel and holidays unforgettable â€“ (other half was well impressed) The Saturday following our return the Independent on Saturday carried a full page review of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ca'Pisani is the chic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: francesca-b
Reviews.Content: Based on Tripadvisor reviews, I picked the Ca'Pisani for a three day break with my husband and 10 year old son. What an inspired choice: I earned lots of brownie points from hubby for having chosen it! We had a junior suite so our son slept in the lounge area which was separated from our bedroom by sliding doors. A TV on either side of the doors helped enormously! Gorgeous real linen sheets, comfortable bed, thirties' style decor with an extra dash of panache, big jacuzzi bath, an array of buttons to operate the shutters and windows - all made for an excellent stay. Staff very pleasant, breakfast very good. Loved the baskets of apples in the corridors; our son thought was it very naughty to pinch one when we came back in the afternoons! Location was excellent; no more than a minute or two from the Accademia vaporetto stop. Would stay here again: a luxurious but relaxed hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Passes the WISTA? test”
Reviews.Author: DRMEngland
Reviews.Content: No question this is the hotel to stay in in Venice. First and to us us most important it is very quiet. No noise whatsoever. Secondly it is in a great position between two water taxi stops. No view of water but as you get that all day it is not a problem. We had a standard room, 'small but perfectly formed'. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The decor was great - lots of Art Deco - and the hotel was spotless. It certainly passes the Would I Stay there Again Test? In fact we would not even consider anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Ca' Pisani- wondeful stay - some comments on Venice”
Reviews.Author: simmie17
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 days at the Ca'Pisani with my teenage daughter. Love the hotel. Had a standard room- was small but adequate. Bathroom was amazing. Twice a day housekeeping a plus. Staff was lovely- very accommodating. Guys in the restaurant recommended great wines for me while using the computer in the lobby. As to Venice, thourougly enjoyed it. We had a 7 day Venice Card pass, but note that most people got on the water buses without paying. Enjoyed meals in Ai Gondolieri, Cipriani (very posh), and local tratterias- esp. one near the hotel called Zattere I think. Very low key. The gelato near the hotel on the boardwalk was great too. Enjoyed the Caffe Florian - had lunch there our last day- listening to the orchestra- wonderful. Also, we hit Harry's Bar twice- yes, the prices are very high but you know that before you order. After all, it's Harry's. And suggest order the Bellini No.1- it's a bigger version of the regular Bellini with vodka and only 1 euro more. Highly recommend the tour of the Jewish Ghetto, whatever your religion. Doge's Secret Tour was ok, though our guide was good. Had 4 tour books and maps, but got lost everywhere. If I went right, I should have gone left. Interestingly, my daughter had a great sense of direction in Venice. Found some of the shopkeepers rude, but ones in the highend stores- Gucci, Hogan and Chanel were great. Saved a huge amount on shoes in Gucci (If you go, ask for Elena). Also enjoyed finds in small out of the ways places, including two in Canareggio- one called Fantasy Glass had the best hand made jewelry at the best prices. Another, near the water boat stop for Murano (Fond. Nuevo?) run by a woman named Lizette was also a find. Also liked the paper shop near the Guggenheim museum- she had the best prices we found for paper goods. Murano is hokey and a tourist trap but still fun. And, of course I bought a scarf, too!

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: brian6u
Reviews.Content: As part of my wife's and my Italian holiday just completed, we began our stay in Venice with three nights at Ca'Pisani Hotel, staying in a "junior suite" (number 4 to be exact). First of all, the hotel staff was always pleasnt, friendly, helpful and attentive to our needs. Their smiling faces and welcoming personalities were most appreciated after 12 hours of travel and more than 5,500 miles. The room, or small suite, that we had selected was very nice, clean and quite modern. Like any hotel in Europe, and especially Venice, it has it's quirks. The challenge for the careful traveler is to navigate the quirks and select properties with acceptable idiosyncracies while passing on those that have issues that might drive you to drink! In our case, while this hotel has some quirks, they were seen as almost charming, and never detracted from the experience of our visit. One "quirk" in the property was internet connectivity. If you are not an expert at configuring your computer to connect to a fixed IP address, either don't try to "IM" your friends from the Ca'Pisani. I'm well above average at making my laptop connect anywhere in the world, and it took me over an hour. The hotel has no lobby to speak of, so if you like to lounge in a lovely lobby, this is not the hotel for you. Ditto the restaurant which was the BIGGEST ripoff in all of our two year travels in Italy. That all being said, the rooms, baths, beds and other elements critical to a nice hotel visit are more than acceptable. The location, about 1000 feet from the Academy Bridge and in a nice neighborhood, is great. It's about a 15 minute walk to San Marco (St. Mark's), and there is much to see and do in the delightful walk. We traveled it many times in our three days at Ca'Pisani and always had fun. So, if you are looking for a nice property with some small issues, Ca'Pisani fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “The thing with Ca Pisani is..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: ...not enough people know about it! Ca Pisani is situated in the art district and it is equidistant between Rialto and San Marco; in that respect it is superbly located since whether its restaurants or galleries or the market or the boutiques that you want- all is nearby. The hotel staff at Ca Pisani was knowledgable and efficient and always available to assist with any request or just generally to give recommendations when asked. The interior scheme is fairly daring and ambitious but appears to have been studiously thought out and the delivery is meticulous in detail. The result is a very practical but uniquely beautiful hotel. We stayed in a luxuriously comfortable room 31 (triplex) with a very Venetain view over the rooftops of the city. It was truly atmospheric and, having stayed at the Danielli and Grand Canal opposite Harrys Bar on my previous visits to Venice, I can wholeheartedly recommend Ca Pisani as the hotel to stay in when in Venice. PS. ladies- the ensuite whilpool tub is the real thing!

Reviews.Title: “Tantilize the Senses...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It's not very often we are so inclined to write such a note of praise... but it is with great pleasure I can now tell everyone how wonderful our visit was at the Ca' Pisani Hotel. Not only were our expectations exceeded in appointed room detail and staff hospitality, but our dinner upon arrival in the restaurant was so exceptional, that it truly was the most delicious and elegantly served in our entire excursion throughout Italy. By being on the ---- site, we found Ca'Pisani to be such a delightful and enjoyable experience with your fine staff of professionals.

Reviews.Title: “Modern luxury for a new generation”
Reviews.Author: LGMG
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in mid January on my honeymoon. The staff were very helpful and subdued. They spent 15 minutes helping us locate certain places on our map one morning. We had a superior room which at first glance looked a little plain, until you looked closer. There were delightful surprises around every corner--little switches to control everything under the sun. The bed was sumptuous with exquisite linen. And the bathroom...the BEST I have ever been in. A huge whirlpool tub, spacious enough for two, the most powerful shower I have ever experienced and lovely soft robes and slippers for ultimate relaxation. I am a vegetarian and I had the best breakfasts of our trip here--not the usual tinned fruit and dodgy pastries here. Great granola and muesli with pumpkin seeds and fresh yogurt, delicious pear cake, chocolate croissants and more. This is luxury for my generation--if gilted mirrors and musty brocade aren't your style, try Ca Pisani. It's sleek and seductive, quiet and romantic. You'll never want to leave the room.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: tif
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel on Oct 26 to 29 in a junior suite #26. The room was very clean especially the bathroom. The cleanning lady was very prompt each morning getting our room tidy and our beds made. By the time be came up from breakfast, our bed was like we never slept in and we never made a mess getting ready in the morning. It is interesting to discover little gadgets around the room like with one button the window screen goes up and down. The staff was very helpful. Also the currency exchange at the front desk was very reasonable and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, service needs improving!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 days as guests of our lovely friends who were getting married in Venice. The hotel is lovely, its is 1930's art deco style, with beautifully laid out public areas and has a fantastic and relaxing roof terrace. We stayed in room 26, a junior suite, which was perfect, very quiet, plenty of space, comfy bed and super bathroom. Breakfast was great, fresh croissants, cheeses and hams etc, very nice to sit outside and watch the world go by. The location of the hotel is ideal, just over the Accademia bridge so much quieter than the San Marco area and a pleasant stroll in all directions. Unfortunately the hotel is very badly let down by the quite amazing lack of customer service of the staff! Apart from one very nice lady in the restaurant, one helpful receptionist and the cheerful porter, all the staff were really not customer focused at all. We were unable to order drinks in the bar after 11pm, despite being residents it was clearly inconvenient for them. One lady was extremely rude to me when I asked for tea and coffee at breakfast time telling me I must not bother her and someone else would come to take the order (my husband went to ask someone else in the end). The most ridiculous thing however was that we were not 'allowed' friends up to the room without ID. Told a credit card would be ok as ID, friends produced them next time and were told that actually they needed their passports! When our friend pointed out he was paying the bill, the receptionist simply said he could have his invoice in that case! It really is a lovely hotel and we had a great time, but they really need to address their customer service issues!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous boutique hotel away from the maddening crowds of San Marco”
Reviews.Author: charlotte2009
Reviews.Content: What a gem of a hotel! We stayed here 2 nights and this hotel was wonderful-silky linen sheets, modern, luxurious bathrooms and toiletries, a high-tech keyless entry system that let the staff know when you were in your room (and therefore you were never disturbed), free internet connection from the lobby, and delicious breakfasts served at tables outside...After tackling the crowds and sights of San Marco, Ca'Pisani was a welcome retreat. We had room 11 and it was so quiet! Even better for heavy packers, the water bus stop is very close. After seeing the ornate halls of the Doge Palace and the many churches of Venice, you will enjoy the clean lines and 1930s chrome and wood architecture of this lovely hotel. Stay here!

HotelInfo.Name: Ca' Pisani Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Dorsoduro 979/a, 30123 Venice, Italy
